loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and blessed with seven children. She operates a piggery business while her husband works as a private driver to make a living. With more than three years in the business, Emma earns well to provide for the family. She was determined enough to sustain and improve the business in order to send her children to school. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed to boost her livestock-raising. Her desire for a better future makes her find ways to improve her ability in doing business.

In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel, a 41-year-old married mother of three, operates a general store to earn a living. Her husband works overseas. She has been running the business for four years and is able to combine her income with her husband's to support their family. 

She wants to improve her store. Without hesitation, she took a loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to buy more grocery goods to sell. She was determined to position her business for success to ensure a better source of income in the future. She wants her family to have a more comfortable and better life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
To make a living, Flora manages her own general store in her village. Her husband is a farmer. The couple earns well from these activities and they are able to provide for their family. Florida has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to purchase some goods for her store. 

Flora finds ways to improve the business to earn more. Recently she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to sustain and improve the business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jovito Sr.

texts.en:
Jovito Sr. is married and has three children. He owns and operates a rice farm to make a living. For many years in farming, Jovito Sr. has earned well and been able to provide for his family. He wants to expand his farm to earn more income in order to support his children's education. He joined GDMPC and took a loan to purchase seeds and cover fertilization costs. 

In the future, Jovito Sr. wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family, while he continues to improve his farm in order to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cover fertilization costs

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
To make a living, Matilde helps her husband operating their own service-based business providing transportation services in their village. After many years in the service, the couple earns a better income to provide their basic needs. She find ways to improve their business and to provide a better service to their costumers. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for vehicle repair.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy new set of tires to replace the old tires.  In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and blessed with two children. Her husband works as a technician.

Farming is the family’s main source of income. For the past four years Rosemarie has helped her husband provide for the family by working on their farm. She has found ways to improve it and has used their vacant lot to gain more in return.

Rosemarie is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy fertilizer and seeds. She hopes with improved yields she can help provide her family with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is married with three children. She helps her husband earn a living by operating their transportation business while her husband works as a security guard. She earns a better income to support her husband's income.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair and buy tires for the vehicle .She is hoping to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to repair and buy tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: To make a living, Maribel operates a retail business in their village while her husband works as seaman. She earns enough from the business to support her family along with her husband's income. She has grown the business and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying additional stocks to sell. Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase additional home products and personal accessories to sell.  She also wants to improve the general living condition of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products and personal accessories to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
To make a living, Lilibeth operates a general store in their village. She earns well from this, aside from her husband's income from working as a mechanic. For many years of the business, Lilibeth was able to sustain it. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing additional stocks to sell. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
To make a living, Laura operates a general store while helping her husband take care of their rice farm. The couple earns well from these businesses to provide for the needs of their four children. Laura sells her farm's produce in town to earn a higher profit. 

Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional rice to sell. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used to improve the farm.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
To make a living, Josephine works with her husband on their own farm. When they have finished working, her husband provides transportation services to earn additional income. 

Josephine earns enough income from the farm to provide for her family. Aside from rice, she also has engaged in a gardening business growing and harvesting different kinds of vegetables.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs and maintenance. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides. 

Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Joward

texts.en: Joward wants to have a better career in the future. He is studying in a university, aiming for a B.S. in Business Administration. His father is earning, from his work as a construction worker. He had three siblings. Joward wants to help his family in the future, so he does his best in order to finish his course of study. In the future, Joward wants to become successful and help his family to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
To make a living, Agustina has been helping her husband operate their own rice farm. For many years, the couple has earned well and it helps her family a lot. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for farming costs. Her efforts and dedication to work make her able to send her children to school.

Recently, Agustina took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

She plans to expand her farm in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina has been operating her general store for more than three years to help her husband earn a living. She earns well from this business, which helps a lot to her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for additional business capital. 

Filomina always finds ways to improve her business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hope to improves her business outcome and generate more income. She wants to provide better living standards in the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been helping her husband for many years working on their own farm to make a living. The couple earns well from this to provide for the needs of the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm costs. 

Aside from farming, she has had a motor transportation service business and it earns well. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to renew her motorcycle registration. 

In the future, Josefina's plan is to save her returns in order to finance the studies of her children.

loans.use: to renew her motorcycle registration

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson, a 39-year-old married man with four children, operates his own piggery business to make a living. He's been in the business for 8 years and earns well to provide for his family. His work effort makes him able to send his children to school and helps him buy some home appliances. He always finds ways to improve the piggery and to gain more income in return.

Recently, Jerson borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase feeds for livestock. He hopes to see his business become more successful. He wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for livestock

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah has been earning from her transportation business for more than six years and she earns well from this. Aside from this, she also sells cosmetics and health products to earn more in return. Leah always find ways to augment her business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for vehicle repair. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional stocks of nutritional products. In the future she hopes to finish her studies and earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nutritional products for her cosmetic and health business

loans.name: Nepomoseno Jr.

texts.en:
Nepomoseno Jr., a 58-year-old married man, has been operating a welding shop for 20 years to make a living. In his effort and determination, he has been able to provide for his family and has sustained these services. He needs to make improvements to his shop to provide more services. He joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy a new electricity transformer .

Looking forward to improving the general living situation of his family, he hopes to expand his business to gain more in return.

loans.use: to buy a new electricity transformer

loans.name: Arcelito

texts.en: Arcelito, a 45 year old married man with eight children, owns and operates a hog raising and swine fattening business, while his wife does house keeping services to make a living. He has been ten years in this line of business and he earns well from this to provide for his family. With his effort, Arcelito was able to sustain this business. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy a piglet and repair the livestock shelter. In the future he wants to improve the general living situation of his family as well as improve his business.

loans.use: to buy piglet and repair the livestock shelter

loans.name: Jecyl

texts.en:
Jecyl is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at a university in Mindanao. She has two siblings, who are both still studying. Her mother earns money from a food vending business. Jecyl has joined GDMPC and requested a loan to pay this school year's tuition fees.

In the future, Jecyl wants to have a career that allows her to support her family and improve the lives of her own future family as well.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Mizel

texts.en:
Mizel, a 25 year old studying  for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration in a university in Oroquieta City. Her dreams of being successful make her determination grow stronger. Her parents earn their income as real state brokers, but with 5 children their income cannot meet all their needs. Mizel  joined GDMPC and has gained access to its micro finance services. She took a new loan to cover the cost for her school projects and miscellaneous expenses.

She is hoping to achieve her goal in life which is to become successful and to support her family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost for school projects and miscellaneous expenses

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
To make a living, Marianita sells different types of products in her merchandise store. She earns well from this and has been able to provide for her family while successfully repaying her previous loan, which she used to improve her business. She always finds ways to offer more goods in order to increase her profits. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more plasticware and ready-to-wear products.

She hopes to grow revenues in order to expand her business. She wants to see her children be successful and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plasticware and ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 37-year-old married woman who operates their farm while her husband works as a security guard to make a living. During the past three years when she has been supervising their farm, the couple have earned well and have been able to provide for their family and buy some home appliances needed for their home. 

Recently, Emily joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer. She is hopeful that she will improve the farm and will be able to use their profits to buy another farm to expand production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy in a university. She was determined to have a better career in the future to be able to help her parents and wants to have a better living in the future.

Mary Jane joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance services for deserving students.

She borrowed a new loan to cover the costs for school allowances and miscellaneous expenses for this current year.

In the future, she wants to achieve her goal to become successful with her career.

loans.use: to pay for school allowances and miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer has been operating his transportation business for five years and he earns well from this. He has successfully repaid his previous loan which he used to buy motor spare parts. 

To maintain a better service, Elmer took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new tires and pay additional maintenance costs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay additional maintenance costs.

loans.name: Jewander

texts.en:
To make a living, a young entrepreneur, Jewander, has been operating a general store for more than threee years. She earns well from it and is able to sustain the business. She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy more goods. 

She always finds ways to improve her business and recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business using her generated revenue and hopes to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, a 57-year-old married woman with six children, has been operating her own service-based business selling food in her little cafeteria. She earns well from this and was able to support her husband's income from working as a carpenter. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

In the future, she wants to improve the business to cater to orders and address catering services. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Yancy

texts.en:
Yancy is single with two children. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation in his village to make a living. He has been running the business for two years and he earns enough to provide for his children. He is also engaged in a buy-and-sell business, selling fish in the neighboring village. 

Recently, he joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to cover vehicle repairs and maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to see his children successful and to have a better family.

loans.use: to cover vehicle repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is married with seven children; he operates a retail store in their village to make a living. He has been doing this for many years. He was able to sustain and improve the business, but he was not able to handle the business properly. 

After joining GDMPC, Arnold learned the possibilities to improve his business with the help of GDMPC. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

He is hoping to improve his business to gain more returns for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean, who is married with three children, operates a general store while her husband works abroad to make a living. After nine years in the business, she earns enough to support the daily needs of the family. She wants to improve her business to gain more profit in return. Her determination to send her children to school makes her find ways to augment her income. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. To improve the business is her passion in order to improve the general living standards of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie helps her husband on their farm to make a living. She has been running a swine-fattening business for more than two years and she earns well from this in addition to raising crops. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to buy feed for her pigs. Elsie hopes to improve her business and improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man who makes a living operating a service-based business providing transportation in their village. For six years, Alex has been earning well and has been able to provide for his family. 
He joined GDMPC recently and is now taking out a new loan for vehicle maintenance costs. With his effort and determination to succeed, he plans to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance costs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has been helping her husband in their business of providing transportation in their village to make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for vehicle repair. Aside from this, the couple have a farm, which is their main source of income. Recently, Victoria has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer in order to improve their farm. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie, 49 years old, helps her husband work their farm to earn a living. She helps him grow and harvest crops and also takes care of boars.  This helps to earn additional income for the family. The couple earns enough from their efforts and are able to send their children to school. 


Because of having two years success raising boars, she decided to raise pigs. She requests a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feed.

Vergie hopes to improve the business and wants to improve the general living of her family as well.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela helps her husband make a living by farming. For more than six years, the couple has earned enough money. They grow cassava,  bananas, and corn. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs. She requests a new loan to buy fertilizer and seed to improve the farm. 

Shiela wants to have a better harvest and expand their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, a 56-year-old married woman with three children, operates a general store to make a living. She earns well from this aside from her husband's income from working as a driver. She had started her business six years ago and after she had joined GDMPC with hopes to improve her ability to engage in business. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business and hopes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jeanesita

texts.en: Jeanesita has been selling grocery goods in her general store to make a living. She earns well from this, aside from her husband's income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in purchasing goods to sell. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is very determined to improve the living situation of her family and wants to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has been selling snacks in her village to earn a living. She earns well from this, aside from her income from farming. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy raw ingredients. 

To improve the farm, her main source of income, Thelma borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase fertilizer and to pay replanting costs on her banana farm. 

Thelma wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay replanting costs on her banana farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has been selling woven nipa in her village for many years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy raw materials for her business. She finds ways to sell her woven nipa in the neighboring town, to gain more income. 

Recently, Jennifer took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional palm leaves, used for manufacturing nipa. Jennifer desires to improve her business, to have a better, more comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional palm leaves.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been making a living by buying and reselling rice for more than three years. She earns well and was able to successfully repay her previous loan. She used this previous loan to buy more rice to sell.  

In addition to selling rice, she also raises pigs to earn more income for the family. Recently, she obtained a new loan to buy piglets and feed. 

Helen hopes for a larger income in the future so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa is married and has three children. For the past six years, she has operated a piggery, earning well for the family. Analisa joined GDMPC in 2013 and recently borrowed a loan to buy feed for her piggery. She is determined to improve her business in order to provide a better life for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina has been selling fish in the market for many years. She earns well from the business to provide for the family, and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business. She was determined enough in sustaining her business. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase more variety of fish to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is married to a businesswoman. They live in Zamboanga del Sur and have two children. 

He operates a piggery to make a living. Allan earns well from this to provide a better living to his family. He had joined GDMPC recently, and he gained access to microfinance services. He borrowed a loan to buy feed and other supplies in order to improve the business. 

In the future, he wants to improve the business, the general living situation of the family, as well to have a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is married with four children and operates a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for many years since she got married and she earns well from this. Her husband earns an income from employment as local government employee. Her income from her business helps her family a lot and she is able to support her children's education. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. Her passion for the family helped her to become determined to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a widow with two children. She manages her own rice farm to make a living. 

She has been harvesting and growing rice for many years, and she earns enough to provide for the family's needs. She wants to improve the farm in order to provide a better education to her children. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently. With micro finance, she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer. 

She is hopeful that she will have an abundant harvest and gain more profit. In the future, she wants to improve the farm and the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
To make a living, Evangeline has been helping her husband in their fishing business. She sells fish in their village and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy nets and hooks. 

To offer more variety and more fish to sell, Evangeline borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children. She works very hard  selling fish to support her family. 

The micro credit from GDMPC enables her to develop her business and purchase fishing nets.  This loan will help her to invest in her business. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married, with two children. To make a living, she helps her husband operate their fishing business. The couple earns well from this. She also sells fish in their village. 

Recently, Maricel borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of nets. Maricel is hopeful enough to provide her family a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of  nets.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has three children. Her husband farms, which yields their main source of income. For three years now Wilma has operated a general store to also help cover the needs of her family.

Wilma is applying for a 35,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to buy additional groceries to sell. She always finds ways to improve her business so as to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo has been a teacher for many years. He is married with an only child.

Bernardo has been a member of GDMPC since 2012. With the desire to become a yet better teacher, he has decided to continue his doctorate program at the university. He is applying for a 16,000 PHP loan to help cover the costs for his doctoral studies.

Bernardo’s decision to continue his studies was not only for his family’s benefit but for his community as well.

loans.use: to help cover the costs for his doctoral studies

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is married with an only child. She helps her husband to earn a living. She buys and sells woven lampakanay products while her husband works as a carpenter in their village. To offer more manufactured products, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional lampakanay leaves. She wants to improve her business, to gain more returns in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional lampakanay leaves.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married with seven children. She operates a hog-raising business to make a living. She has been doing this for two years and earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her general store. She used her returns (profits) to pay for some home improvements. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed for her hogs. She hopes to gain more profit to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Reny

texts.en:
Reny is married and has one child.  He operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle transportation in his village to earn a living while his wife is working as a private employee. 

Reny has been a member of GDMPC and has taken out a loan to cover the cost of motorcycle repair necessary for his transportation business.

In the future, he wants to provide his family a better and more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico has been operating a general store to make a living. Rico has been in this business for 11 years and earns well for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to buy more goods to sell.  

Rico joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services and to improve his ability to be an entrepreneur. He recently took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more goods. He plans to expand the business to gain more income for the future education of his son.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en: Marmie is studying Information Technology at a university in Zamboanga del Sur. Her mother is a businesswoman and her father is a farmer. She has seven siblings still depending on her parent's support. Marmie wants to become successful in her career to uplift the situation of her family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to pay school tuition fees for the second semester of this current school year. She hopes to find a better job in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia has been operating a transportation service based business in their village for six years to make a living. She lets her tenants transport customers and packages. She earns well from this and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to buy spare parts. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires to replace the existing used tires to provide a secure and more comfortable service. She wants to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Romilaine

texts.en: Romilaine has been helping her husband by working on their farm to make a living. From many years of farming, she earns enough to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farm inputs. She always finds ways to augment their farming activities to gain more income for the family. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic pesticides and fertilizer to improve the farm. Romilaine hopes to cultivate more and to sustain the farm to ensure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita has been operating a general store to make a living. For more than four years in running the store, she earns well to provide for her needs. 

She had successfully paid her previous loans used for buying stock for the business. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit  to buy more cosmetics products to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue that the loan generates to add her business capital, and to further improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is married with two children and operates a general store while her husband works as a private employee to make a living. Over more than twelve years in the business, Elmie has experienced ups and downs but she never stops getting better. She joined GDMPC in 2013 and she gained access to micro finance services and help her improve her ability to engage in business. 

Elmie took out a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She always find ways to improve her business in order to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan, a young entrepreneur of Zamboanga del Norte operates a general store to make a living. He has been doing this for two years and he earns well enough to improve it. 

He joined GDMPC in 2013 and it helped his ability to engage in business. Roldan borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. 

His dream is to improve the business in order to ensure a better income for his future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana makes a living farming her own farm. She has grown and harvested bananas for more than ten years.   This income helps to meet her needs. 

She successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to buy chemicals. She always finds ways to improve her production and increase her earnings.  Cresenciana requests a loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance. She plans to cultivate a vacant lot to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Juanifiel

texts.en: Juanifiel is studying for her Bachelor of Science major in accounting at the university. She has three siblings that still depend on their parents. Her father is earning an income from his farming while her mother is a housekeeper. She finds ways to finish her studies in order to be able to help her family uplift their living situation. She had joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay for the school tuition fee for the second semester this current school year.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fee.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en: Cherly wants to be an accountant in the future and she's still studying at a university. She has four siblings and her father earns a living through farming. She joined GDMPC last year and used her previous loan for school material costs. Recently, she borrowed another loan to cover the costs of her allowances and other miscellaneous items for the second semester this current year. In the future, Cherly wants to finish her studies and help her family to have a better living.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her allowances and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is separated and is the sole provider for her children. She operates a general store in their village and earns well from this. She has three children who want to have a better education. She recently joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan under micro-finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Rowena wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income and hopes to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 49, a single entrepreneur who operates a general store in her village to make a living. She has had this business for over three years, earning well for her needs. After she joined GDMPC, it helped her ability to improve on how to engage in business. Elsa borrowed a loan under GDMPC micro-credit to purchase more grocery items to add her inventory. Elsa is hoping to become successful in her business and wants to improve it in order to have a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to add to her inventory

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Myrna has been operating a general store to make a living for over twelve years. She earns well and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She always finds ways to improve!

Recently she has taken a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as working capital for her business, and to assure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly has been providing transportation services in his community for more than four years and he earns well from this to provide the family. He successfully repaid his previous loan for spare parts and accessories. Rolly wants to provide his only son a better education in the future, and ensure improving the services for his family. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new tires to replace the old ones.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie has been helping her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She has been doing this for 14 years and she earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for fishing materials. After fishing, she sells fish in their village to gain more returns. In order to offer more, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional fish to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to resell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda has been operating a general store in her village for many years to make a living. She earns well from this business and was able to support her children's education. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for the improvement of the business. She had to find ways to gain more income for the benefit of her children. Without hesitation, she took a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy more grocery goods to sell. She hopes that this will help to pay for her children’s education and for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Noralie

texts.en: Noralie is a single mother of one who operates a farm to earn a living. Doing this for more than two years, Noralie earns enough to provide her needs. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She needs the improvement of her farm to gain more returns from it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. Hoping for a better future, she wants to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has been raising pigs for three years and he earns well from this. He improved his piggery with his profit and successfully repaid his previous loan used in buying feed and piglets. He is now on his way to improving  his business. 

Recently, he took out a new loan to buy feed and other supplies. He hopes to have more profit to use as additional capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en: Elyn has been helping her husband work on their farm to make a living. The couple makes a good income and has successfully repaid the previous loans she used to buy farm supplies. She works hard to improve her farm to ensure a better income for the family. Recently, she requested a new loan from GDMPC to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest so that she can increase their income to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ritchiel

texts.en: Ritchiel is married with three children. Her husband works as a cook in a private facility while she earns a living by selling electronic items to people in her community. She joined GDMPC recently and has requested a loan to buy electronic items to sell. She plans to improve her retailing business to earn more for the family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more electronic items to sell

loans.name: Alkein

texts.en:
Alkein is studying at a university in order to reach his dream of having a better career in the future. 

His parents wake up every morning and sell fish at the market in order to provide for the family. Because of his father's low income, he cannot afford to pay all the school obligations. Seeking a better education, Alkein joined GDMPC to borrow money to pay for his school tuition fees for this semester.

In the future, Alkein wants to become successful .

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Alrey

texts.en:
Alrey is a 23-year-old man, studying in a university to gain a better education. He is single and he helps his parents in their business on weekends, when he doesn't have any scheduled time for a group study. His parents are earning a little income from selling fish in their village. 

Alrey joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2013 and had borrowed a loan to pay for school tuition fees. In the future, Alrey would like to find a job that fits his qualifications and to earn money, to own a business for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is married with five children, and helps her husband manage their own farm for a living. Aside from this, she also vends barbecue, and serves as a manicurist in their village, to earn more income to provide for her family. After three years in these activities, Emelyn doesn't have enough savings for the future education of her children. She decided to borrow a loan from GDMPC micro credit to start improving her banana farm, and using a portion to buy ingredients for barbecue. She hopes to find success for the family in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost for weeding maintenance to improve her farm.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with an only child. She sells balut (fertilized duck eggs) in their community to make a living.
For more than ten years of running this business, the couple earns well to provide for the needs of the family. She had joined GDMPC in 2010 and recently took out a new loan to purchase eggs for balut vending. In the future, she wants to see her child successful and hopes to have a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase eggs for balut vending

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is running a general store selling a variety of food and grocery goods in her village. Eliza has been in this business for more than four years and she earns enough to provide for the needs of her family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She wants to improve the business to gain more return. Without hesitation, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Diana Lou

texts.en: Diana Lou is now studying in a university where she is going to graduate this year. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of the journey and the success she has now for providing loans for deserving students. Recently, she took out a loan from GDMPC to pay graduation fees. She is hopeful to find a better career for a better future.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees

loans.name: Jezza

texts.en: Jezza is studying at university to have a better career in the future. She believes that education is one factor of success. She was thankful to GDMPC for being a part of it. She had joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay for graduation fees. She is hopeful to find a job in the future to be able to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita helps her husband operate their farm to make a living. Aside from this, she has a business selling snacks and fruit, and she earns well from this. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to buy more fruit to sell. She plans to build a more comfortable shelter for her store in order to sell more products and improve her income. She wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn owns and operates a business, raising pigs for sale. For ten years, she has earned well from selling pigs and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying piglets. Aside from this, she sells fish in their village to earn more income. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional varieties of fish to sell. She wants to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anna Fe

texts.en:
Anna Fe is married and has three children. She helps her husband operate their own rice farm to make a living. She has been doing this for ten years and they have been able to provide their family. 

Recently, Anna Fe borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy fertilizer. She hopes to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is married and she helps her husband working on their own farm to make a living. For five years, the couple has earned well and saved money to build their house. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides in order to improve their rice production business.

They make sure to improve their farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and operates a general store while her husband does farming to make a living. Ester has run the business for 8 years and earns well from this and is able to support her husband's income. She had to buy some home appliances out from her earnings. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business and wants to have  a better living with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Syd Ann

texts.en: Syd Ann is married with two children and helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. She has been farming for seven years, earning a good income for the family. She plans to improve the farm in order to better support her family. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en: Rovelyn is married with two children and helps her husband working on their own farm for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. The couple earns well for the family. Recently, Rovelyn joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer. Improving their farm is their dream, for it is their main source of income and she wants to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vicent Cyril

texts.en:
Vicent Cyril has been running a service-based business providing transportation in his community. He has been doing this for more than three years and has been earning well for the family. 

He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for repairs and tires. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy a motorcycle for business expansion. It is his dream to provide a better standard of living for his family in the future. With this business, it will be a big help to turn his dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for business expansion.

loans.name: Welfie

texts.en: Welfie is married with three children, and operates a farm with her husband to earn a living. For thirteen years in farming, the couple was able to provide the needs of the family. With the regular income they had earned from farming, sending their children to school will be difficult for them. They planned to expand the farm in order to gain more return. She joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer. Hoping that in the future, the general living situation of the entire family will be improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has been operating a farm with her husband for more than five years and the couple earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), used for farm inputs. 

She had planned to improve the farm in order to get more returns, to use them for her children's education. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer. 

In the future, Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly has been running a general store and a cafeteria in his village for three years in order to make a living.  He earns enough from this that he is able to provide for his family. He had successfully repaid the previous loan used for the business. 

Yolly joined GDMPC in 2012 and it helps his ability to engage business. His determination makes him work punctually and diligently in order to improve his business and the general living situation of his family.

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional ingredients and cooking pots in order to serve catering services. He wants to become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and cooking pots in order to serve catering services

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela has been helping her husband operate a farming business to earn a living. They plant and harvest rice for consumption and sell a portion of it for their needs. After many years of farming, the couple earns s good income and had Rosela successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. She always finds ways to help the family avoid financial adversity. They work hard on their farm in order to improve and gain a more abundant harvest.
 
Recently, she took a new loan to buy pesticides, seeds and pay for weeding maintenance costs.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, seeds and pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Rhine Sheila

texts.en:
Rhine Sheila has been running her transportation business for three years earning well to support her needs.  

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor repair and recently borrowed a new loan to buy new tires to replace the old ones.  She wants to become successful and earn a strong source of income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Avessel

texts.en:
Avessel is married, with an only child. He works in a private company, as a security guard to earn a living. He also operates a service-based business on weekends, providing motor transportation in their community. Early in the morning, he uses the motorcycle to vend fish in their village and he earns a better income from this activity. He has been a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) for four years. 

Recently, Avessel took a new loan to buy tires and to renew his motor registration. In the future, Avessel wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and to renew his motor registration.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has been helping her husband working on their own farm to make a living. In return for their many years of farming, the couple earns well to provide the family. 

Emma has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. Emma finds ways to improve their income. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for the next crop.  

In the future, Emma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the next crop

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta has owned & operated a general store for many years to earn a living. She earns well from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Her training acquired from GDMPC helps her ability to improve her business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She was determined to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mida

texts.en: Mida is married with two children and operates a buy and sell business to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends banana cue while her husband does a transportation services. The couple earns well from the business and it helps improve their living. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy additional banana and other ingredients to prepare snacks to vend. In the future, she wants to build a store to sell groceries in their village to earn more.

loans.use: to buy additional banana and other ingredients

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo has been raising pigs and harvests crops to make a living. Aside from this, he also vends buco juice and snacks in the market and her earns well from this. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for his piggery. He always find ways to improve the quality of life for his family. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase feeds and a portion will be used for his vending business. In the future, Danilo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and a portion will be used for his vending business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto owns and operates a banana farm to make a living. For five years, he has earned well and had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying fertilizer. Their farm improved but he had to find ways to earn more for the big family. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to make improvements on his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is married and was blessed with six children. He owns and operates a piggery in order to earn a living. He has been able to provide the needs of the family and has sent some of his children to college. 

Dominador borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase additional piglets to raise. He hopes to earn greater returns from this business to ensure a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn has been helping her husband operating their farm to make a living. For six years on the farm, the couple earns well to provide the needs of the family, and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She became a member of GDMPC in 2011 and it helps her ability to engage business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena has been running a general store to make a living. She also sells fruit to earn more income. 

She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2008 and has successfully repaid her previous loans that have been used for business improvements. She is thankful to GDMPC that through its services, she was able to handle her business properly. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to see her children successful and hopes to improve the general standard of living of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en: Cecil, 40 years old, is married and has two children. She sells her homemade longanisa (sausages made from meat) in their village. She has been doing this business for 10 years and Cecil earns well from this. She invites her friends to help her produce longanisa and shares with them a portion of her profit. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase raw ingredients to prepare more sausage. She was taken photo with her own motorcycle used in vending their product in their community. In some other time. the motorcycle was used for transportation and rental and she earns an income from this. She hopes to expand her business to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare sausage

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en:
Leopolda has been running a retail store for many years while her husband does transportation services to make a living. She earns well and is able to meet the needs of her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan, used for tires and motor accessories. 

Leopolda is determined to improve the business for the future education of her children. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to sell. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Milnar

texts.en:
Milnar is married with three children. He operates a motorcycle transport business while his wife runs a general store to make a living. He has been doing this for more than two years and he earns well from this activity. Recently, Milnar took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy tires in order to replace his old, used tires. 

Milnar finds ways to save money to improve the general store of his wife in order to give his children a better education. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is married and operates a general store in their village to earn a living. She has been selling grocery goods for two years earning well for the family while her husband works in a private company as lineman. She joined GDMPC in 2013 and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to gain more profit in order to add capital to her business. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell at her store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is married with two children and operates a general store to make a living. She has been doing this business for five years and she earns well from this. Her husband's income comes from driving. To improve her business, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn has been selling nipa palm products in her community to make a living. For three years, she has earned a better income that helps support the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying nipa to sell. Aside from this, she also was engaged in selling charcoal and she earns more income from this. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional charcoal to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to resell

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en: Calixto manages his own farm, planting and harvesting corn for consumption and delivering a portion of the produce for sale at the market. For thirteen years in operating the farm, Calixto was able to provide for his family and successfully repaid his previous loan used for fertilization and land preparation costs. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for this cropping season.  He hopes to produce more harvest this cropping season in order to generate more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jenry

texts.en:
Jenry owns and manages a cellphone accessories business in his local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than five years, earning well for the family. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan used for business capital. He was able to improve the business, too. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase additional products and accessories to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.en: Nehemias has been offering a service based business repairing home appliances and other electronic items. He has been in this business for more than seven years earning for the family. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying accessories. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional accessories and electronic parts used in repair services. This accessories would help Nehemias improve his services, particularly in repairing and enhancing sound systems.  Nehemias plans to expand and improve his shop for a better service.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories and electronic parts used in repair services

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married, with four children. She helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. For ten years of fishing, the couple earned well to provide for the needs of the family. Tessie worked hard and saved a portion of her returns for the future education of her children. 

Tessie had to make some improvements to her business to gain more income for the family. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase fishing materials. In the future, she wants to own a fishing boat, to be used for their fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is married and is operating a general store to make a living. She has five years of experience in this business and therefore has a great deal of knowledge about the market and demands of customers.  She started his business with a small amount of capital to sell assorted groceries. She and her husband are the sources of income for the family. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to establish rice retailing in addition to her business. In the future, she wants to become successful with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to establish rice retailing

loans.name: Daffodil

texts.en: Daffodil is married with three children and she operates a general store to make a living. She earns a better income from this business and was able to support her husband's income from his wages paid for his work. For three years, Daffodil was able to sustain the business, but it now needs improvement in order to support the increasing needs of her family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods for resale. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for resale.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn helps her husband cultivate a vegetable garden to make a living. She has been doing this for eight years, and the couple earns a good income for their family. Roselyn has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for farm inputs. She always wants to improve her garden to earn more income. Recently, she has requested a new loan from GDMPC to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, Roselyn wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is an IT student in a university in Zamboanga del Sur. 

Her father has a tricycle transportation service to earn a living. She is thankful that, even in their situation, her parents are still pushing her to continue her studies. 

She used her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC  in order to finance her school tuition fees. Her school supplies and other expenses will be shouldered by her hardworking father.  Recently, she took another loan to finance the costs for allowances and miscellaneous expenses.

She is very much hopeful that despite their situation, she can continue studying for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for allowances and miscellaneous university expenses.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has been helping her husband in their fishing business to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years and was able to sustain their living.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for their business. Aside from this, she also has general store where she earns more income. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional fish to sell in her village. In the future, Lucia wants to build a house and support her children in finishing their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine has been in her piggery business for many years, earning well to make her living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for the piggery and she had improved her business. She had to expand it to earn more returns. 

Recently, Geraldine took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional piglets. This expansion will help Geraldine to earn more profit. She plans to save a portion of the money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia operates a general store to earn a living, and she has been doing this for many years. She earns a good income from this aside from her husband's income from working as carpenter. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for purchasing goods. Recently, she took another loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She was assured to have more income from her investments. She plans to use her profit to increase her working inventory capital for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Naty

texts.en: Naty is married with six children, and has been working in her grocery retailing business for a year. She earns well from this activity, in addition to her husband's income from fishing. She borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family, and would like to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel  owns and operates a retail business selling rice in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns well from it. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying a weighing scale. Aside from this rice retailing business, she has a farm, their main source of income which is managed by her husband. She borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer in order to gain more profit. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth helps her husband  farm to make a living. She is married with seven children. She has a big family to support so they need to earn more money to provide for the family's needs.

Aside from harvesting coconuts, she used to grow and harvest other crops like corn and banana. She joined GDMPC and applied for a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future, she wants to have a greener farm to ensure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with two children and operates a general store.  His wife works as a receptionist in a private company. He works more than eight hours in his store just to gain more returns for the family.  He earns well from his store and finds ways to improve it. He requests a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. 

As a father of two, he wants to see his children finish their studies in  the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa operates her own farm to make a living. She had two children and her husband works as a welder. During vacant days and weekends, her husband helps her on their farm. She joined GDMPC and took out a loan to cover the costs for replanting bananas.

She plans to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for replanting of banana

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married with two children and operates a bakeshop while her husband does farming to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years with the help of her three assistants. It also helps them to earn a living. Recently she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more raw ingredients to prepare bread and pastries for sale. In the future she wants to expand her bakeshop to gain more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a single entrepreneur who owns and operates a general store to make a living. She has been in the business for five years and earns a good income to meet her living standards. 

She joined GDMPC and requests a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business and save a portion of her profit to use it for her future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a farmer. He is married with three children and is also engaged in a buying and selling business, selling fruits in their community to make a living. His earning from farming cannot meet their daily needs, for he only harvests his farm produce every three or four months. To settle this, he buys fruits in addition to his harvest to sell in town.

He joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to buy additional varieties of fruits to sell. Allan will find ways to gain profits aside from farming to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fruits to sell

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is married with two children. She owns and operates a general store to earn a living. She earns well from this, aside from her husband's income from working as a security guard. She finds ways to improve her business and is thankful that she became a member of GDMPC. She has taken out a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She plans to extend her general store's shelter so she can start up a cafeteria in  order to earn more profit for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lady Ann

texts.en:
Lady Ann is studying to obtain a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology at Misamis University in Oroquieta City. She helped her mother every weekend to earn extra money, but her savings are not enough to cover the costs to finance her thesis and project required by her school.

Lady Ann’s previous loan was used for the educational tour costs required by the university. She has now obtained a new 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to cover her needs this semester.

In the future she wants to be successful in her career.

loans.use: to finance her thesis and project required by her school.

loans.name: Daisy Lou

texts.en:
Daisy Lou is a 20-year-old university student studying for a BS in Criminology. She has four siblings who are still depending on her parents' income. Her father works on their own farm for a living, while her mother takes care of their home. She is determined to find success to be able to support her family. She is requesting a loan from GDMPC microfinance to pay her school tuition fees. 
In the future, she wants to become successful in order to help her family and her community as well.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Jo Roxan

texts.en: Jo Roxan is studying Information technology in a university. His father works abroad and his mother serves as a community volunteer. He has six siblings who are still studying . His father's income in not sufficient for their needs.  He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to help in supporting his family financially because of the financial crisis they are facing. However, Jo Roxan's parents don't have enough money to pay the school tuition fees and finance his field trip. This loan helps Jo Roxan a lot in achieving his goal and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees and finance his school field trip

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is studying BS - Business Administration at a university. Having seven sibling is quite not easy to handle for a construction worker and a housekeeper, but for Rudelyn, it is a challenge.  A challenge to help one another in the future. With the privileges offered by GDMPC, she is hopeful to achieve her dreams. To cover the cost for her school allowances and miscellaneous fees, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance. 

In the future, she wants to find a better career in order to support her family and extend it to her siblings.

loans.use: to cover the cost for her school allowances and miscellaneous fees.

loans.name: Romella

texts.en:
Romella owns and operates a swine fattening business, while her husband works as a government employee to earn a living. During two years in her business, she was able to help and support her husband's income for the family. Her business was improved, and she needs more capital to add revenue. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy piglets. She became convinced she could improve the business with the support of GDMPC.
 
She wants to improve her business to gain more profit for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Alyette

texts.en:
Alyette is a single entrepreneur with an only child. She operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells barbecue to earn extra income. Over ten years of running the business, she has earned well enough to support the needs of her child and was able to sustain the business.  

Alyette borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married with three children. She owns and operates a general store to make a living. Her husband is a fisherman, and her store helps to support his income from fishing. 

She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to purchase rice and more grocery goods to sell. With her six years of experience in running the business, she already had a capacity to improve it. In the future, she wants to expand the store and wants to ensure a better source of income. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a single entrepreneur who has fun in his piggery business. For two years, he has earned an income to support his needs. Recently, he decided to build a shelter to start a fattening business to earn more profit. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy feed to boosts her pigs. In the future, Nelson wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio is married with four children.  He provides transportation in his community to make a living.  His wife sells grocery goods in their own general store, and they are able to provide for their family. 

Having four children is not easy, but they are determined to improve their lives.  The couple never gets tired from working. 

Anastacio seeks a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of motor maintenance.  He plans to improve his business by having another motorcycle for rent.  

In the future, Anastacio want to improve the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor maintenance.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, a mother of four, helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. Over twenty years of farming, the couple has earned well enough to provide for the family.  

Lucia borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm as they have planned. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eumi

texts.en: Eumi is married with two children and operates a fishing business to make a living. His wife sells their fish in their village. He has been in this field for ten years and he earns enough to provide for his family. Recently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing net to use for his fishing business. In the future, the couple wants to own a stall in the market in town where they could sell their fish. Eumi wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a single mom of two who earns a living from her service-based business providing electronic loans in their village. For more than a year, she has earned enough to start a sari-sari store. She had a farm, the main source of income, and her previous loan was used for farm inputs.
