She had successfully repaid her previous loan from the earnings she derived from farming.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase additional electronic loads to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business to secure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Genna Marie

texts.en: Genna Marie, a mother of four children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For eight years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. She plans to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, a 31 year old mother of three, helps her husband run their farm.  He works at a private company as a backhoe operator. 

For many years of growing and harvesting coconuts and other crops, the couple has been able to provide for their family.  

In order to enhance her farm, Nelia seeks a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. 

Nelia hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is married with two children and provides transportation services in their village while his wife works as a teacher. He successfully repaid his previous loan used for motorcycle repair. The couple also plans to improve their house while their children are still young because in the coming years, they are going to send them to college. 

Recently, Rechie borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover maintenance costs for his motorcycle. Rechie wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair his motorcycle and to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married with two children and, to earn a living, operates a fish-vending business together with his wife. Over more than five years of running the business, they have earned well for the family.  Elmer is determined to send his children to school and provide a better education and with this goal in mind, they work with love so that they never get tired of working. 

Elmer borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more variety of fish to sell. He uses a motorcycle to sell fish in the neighboring village to earn more profit. In the future, he wants to build a concrete home for his family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita solely provides the needs of her children from raising pigs to earn a living. Aside from this, she also grows bananas and vegetables in her garden to earn extra income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs.  She needs to improve her business for she is the only source of income. Without hesitation she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy feed to boost her pigs. Her future plan is to build a piggery shelter where she can keep pigs to raise as expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed to boost her pigs

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin, a father of one child, provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than a year, he has earned enough to provide for his family.  He needs to repair and maintain his motorcycle to improve services to his customers. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan will be realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to use for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn is married with four children and operates a motorcycle transportation business. Her husband works on their own farm to make a living. She has run the transportation business for three years. Jenalyn is happy to say that this income helps her family a lot while awaiting the harvest of their crops. She borrowed from GDMPC microfinance to buy new tires to replace on her motorcycle. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace on her motorcycle..

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en: Gemalyn lives in Misamis Occidental with her three children. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and started it a year ago. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit   to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles and spices. She plans to expand her store in order to earn more income for family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles and spices

loans.name: Mavy

texts.en: Mavy is 35 years old, married with three children and lives in Misamis Occidental. Her husband works abroad and she helps him by managing their farm. In order to cover the costs of banana replanting and weeding maintenance, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit, which she joined last year. She hopes to have a bigger harvest in order to send her children to school and provide the needs of the family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for replanting and weeding

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him by growing rice to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy fertilizer. She has been doing this for 15 years to earn a living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to grow vegetables in order to generate more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn helps her husband operate a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for seven years, and earns well for the family.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the fishing business.

Aside from this, she was also engaged in farming. She took a loan recently to purchase fertilizer.

Marlyn wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is married with five children. She sells snacks, specializing in puto or steamed rice cakes, to make a living. Her husband is a driver. She has been doing this business for five years, earning well for the family. 

She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy additional ingredients and an additional steamer. She wants to improve her business by adding more flavors and deal in some public schools to earn more profit. 

In the future, she wants to see her children successful, for it is her only hope to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and an additional steamer.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita solely provided for the family since she has been separated from her husband. She has a service-based business that provides transportation in their community to earn a living. 

She has successfully been running her business for 10 years, and she earns a good living from it.  

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy tires and other accessories for her vehicle so she can provide a better service to her costumers. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy tires and other accessories for her vehicle

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is a single entrepreneur who operates a food production business, selling food, snacks and groceries in their village to earn a living. For four years, she has earned well to support her needs and those of her direct family as well. She joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance services. She borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to improve her shelter to provide comfortable services for her customers. She wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is married with three children.  She operates a fishing business while her husband works as a driver to earn a living. 

She has been selling fish in their village for three years; it helps a lot in supporting her husband’s income for the family. She had sustained her business and was able to give allowances to her children going to school. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and took a loan to buy fishing nets. 

In the future, Anecita wants to own more fishing boats to expand her business in order to improve their income so the family has a better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Theodo

texts.en: Theodo is married with three children. To make a living, he operates a service-based business providing transportation in their community. For more than ten years, he has earned well to provide for the family. Though his wife is working abroad as a domestic helper, he never wastes his time in some nonsense lifestyle, but he is determined to improve their living.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover the costs for vehicle maintenance.  In the future, he wants to improve their house, as well as their business, to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to pay maintenance costs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria, a mother of three, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. It is their main source of income but they need another income source for the family's needs.  For 10 years, the couple has earned income from selling fish in their neighboring village. She had planned to improve their farm to send her children to school. Recently, Candelaria took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional fish to sell to have higher returns. In the future she wants to provide a good education for her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul is married with two children, and operates his own farm to make a living. For many years of harvesting rice and vegetables, he earned well for the family and had sent his children to school. To improve the farm, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy fertilizer. 

He hopes to have an abundant harvest to gain more income for a better future for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dioselyn

texts.en:
Dioselyn, a mother of three, has managed a general store for three years, and she earns well to support her husband’s income. She has sustained it with the support of the entire family. The couple wants to provide a better education to their children, so she has to work more for it. She took a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has been selling farm products in her village aside from her general store. She supplies fruits and vegetables in the market that she acquired from her neighbor. Her children are with their own families, and she has to earn for their needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy more fruits to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. Emma hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Misamis Occidental with three of her children. She has been farming for many years, earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was to buy fertilizer. Aside from this, she runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn more money for a living and has had this business for 13 years. She is the sole provider for family with earnings, since she became a widow. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jelito

texts.en:
Jelito is a widower with three children who operates a general store and is a snack vender in his village. He has run this business for 13 years and earns well enough to provide for his family. Jelito has been doing this to make money aside from what he makes from farming. He earns well from his farm and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for farm inputs. 

With the microfinance loan taken from GDMPC, he can buy more groceries and some ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. In the future, Jelito wants to see his children be successful.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Jugina

texts.en: Jugina is married with five children. She owns and operates a gardening business to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She earns well from her garden and she wants to expand it to earn more for the family. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seedling. In the future, Jugina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie owns and operates a general store in her village to earn a living. She has been with her business for three years and earns well for her needs. She was able to support her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to gain more profit. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. She dreams of supporting her parents in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rey Ann

texts.en: Rey Ann operates a business of weaving and selling nipa (hut-construction panels made of woven leaves) in the local community. She's been with her business for years and earns well for her needs. She had inherited this business from her parents. Aside from this, she started recently a retail business to make more money of her own. She took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy more grocery goods to sell. She still continues her nipa business to gain more profit for her education. She hopes in the future to have a better life and to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en: Raul, a father of three, provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than three years, he has earned well to provide for the family.  He needs to repair and maintain his motorcycle to improve the services he provides to his customers. His wife operates a general store in order to earn more returns because they want to give their children a better education. With the micro finance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new unit of motorcycle to use for the expansion of his services.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is married with three children and operates a transportation business while his wife manages a general store for a living. In three years of running a transportation business, Romeo is happy to say that this has helped his family a lot while waiting for his children to finish their studies. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy new replacement tires. In the future, he wants to improve his business to reach his dreams of having a better living with his family.

loans.use: to buy new replacement tires.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina has been running her general store while her husband does fishing to earn a living. She earns well from this activity and successfully repaid her previous loan used for the retail business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to make her general store a full merchandise store in order to have a better source of income and a more comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie owns and operates a plot of farmland and grows bananas to earn a living. She and her husband have done this for six years and they earn well from it.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She wants to make further improvements and asks for a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

Tessie wants to improve the general living condition of her family and hopes to see her children become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds..

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, a mother of four, manages her own general store while her husband does farming to make a living. For three years in this field of business, she has earned a good income that has enabled her to support the needs of her children and to sustain them.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela, a mother of three, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband on their farm to earn more. For three years, she has earned well for the miscellaneous needs of her family. In order to attract customers to her store, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, a young entrepreneur and a mother of one, operates a general store with the help of her husband. For many years, she was able to support the family. She needs more grocery goods to display in her store to attract customers. Because of this, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell.   She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. She wants to have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, a mother of three, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband plant and harvest crops. For three years, she was able to sustained and support her children’s education. In order to offer more to her costumers, she asks for a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, a young widow with an only child of 2, operates a general store to make a living. For years in this business, she has earned well to support her child and was able to sustain it. She had to improve her business for she solely provides for the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, a mother of two,  operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends snacks to earn extra income. For three years in running the business, she earned enough to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain it.  Her husband manages their main source of income which is their farm.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante, a father of five, operates his own farm for a living. For many years of farming, the couple have earned enough to provide for the family. He was working on his farm while taking responsibility for feeding their large cattle to be sold in the future.  From his income, he had successfully repaid his previous loan used it for farm inputs. Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm, as they planned. In the future, he wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bbc

texts.en:
Bbc is a married woman who sells woven nipa in her village.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

As you can see from her photo, Bbc sells nicely manufactured products made from her own hand.  She also buys similar item to sell to her neighbors in town.  

Bbc says she is satisfied with her business’ income since she had many customers who visit her place to make purchases.  Even so, Bbc is asking for a loan to enlarge her business.  She expects an increase in demand this summer. 

Bbc is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more palm leaves and woven products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more palm leaves and woven products to sell.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita grows, harvests and sells bananas.  Her income has helped to support her family for many years. 

To improve her farm, Charita seeks a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer. 

Charita hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en: Anie is married with four children. She helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling banana and she earns well to support their needs. To improve the farm she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and to cover replanting cost.  She had to be determined in her work to give adequate allowance for her children. In order to enhance her farm, she borrows a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is a married man who sells foods in his village with the help of his wife to make a living. He sells his own home-made food in his cafe, and he earns good money from this. Edilberto also sells some groceries in his cafe to his customers. He says he is satisfied with his business' income since he has had many loyal customers who visit his place to eat. 

Edilberto is asking a loan to buy additional ingredients to make home-made food. In the future, he wants to improve his business to achieve his dreams of having a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to make home-made food

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn operates a farm growing and harvesting bananas for sale. After many years on the farm, she is earning a better income for the family. She wants to improve the farm to gain more return, so she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Desedeia

texts.en:
Desedeia helps her husband work on their own farm for a living. She has a vegetable garden where she earns an income daily from selling fresh vegetables in their village. She also delivers bananas twice a month. She earns from the business, and they plan to improve it.

Currently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

In the future, Desederia wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family and hopes to improve and sustain the farm to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en: Darryl is married and operates a transportation business for a living. For three years in running a transportation business Darryl is happy to say that this helps expenses for his family. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy new tires for his motorcycle to replace the old ones. In the future he wants to improve their business to reach their dreams of having a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle for business.

loans.name: Jomalyn

texts.en:
Jomalyn raises pigs to sell in the local community and at the same time, she also sells rope from her self-woven products to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than four years, earning well for the family. She has repaid her previous loan successfully. Her previous loan was used in buying feed for her pigs.

To enlarge her business, she took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more lampakanay leaves and woven products to sell in town. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more lampakanay leaves and woven products to sell in town.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna helps her husband with operating their own farm to earn a living. For five years, she has harvested and gained income from their vegetable garden. To cope with the increase in demand for farm produce, the couple had to expand their plot. She joined GDMPC  recently and borrowed a loan to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate better income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza has been selling groceries in their village, and it helps a lot to support her husband's income. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She strives hard to provide her children with a better education. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the generated revenue as additional capital to expand her business. She wants to gain more income to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe lives in Misamis Occidental and runs a general store, selling goods in her village to earn a living, while her husband does farming. For three years in running the business, she has supported her husband's income and was able to buy a television set from her profit.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband does farming. For three years, Marissa has earned well and sustained the business. She had also bought some home improvements like appliances. She had competitors in the village but she never worried for she had her loyal customers who visited her store and made some purchases.

To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jayvan

texts.en: Jayvan  is still studying in college to earn a  Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. He had to pursue his studies for he has an only child that needs his support. He helps his parents in the farm for he still depends on them. His previous loan was used to pay his previous tuition fees. Recently, he took out a new loan to pay for the second semester tuition fees. He wants to be successful in order to give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en: Ryan is married and has three children. He has operated a transportation business for five years and earns a good living. Ryan is happy to say that, once the business had been running for three years, it has provided a lot of help to his family. He successfully repaid his previous loan of funds borrowed to use in the business. Recently, he took out a new loan to buy new tires and replace the old ones. In the future, he plans to use the additional revenue generated with the help of his loan to improve his vehicle and have an additional motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the motorcycle that he uses in his transportation business.

loans.name: Richmie

texts.en:
Richmie  has been  providing  transportation services in their village for years. She has a driver who operates her motorcycle while she is working in a private company.  As one of the breadwinners of the family, she had to double her income to support her parents. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business. She borrowed a new  loan from GDMPC to cover the costs for licenses and renewal of registration. 

Richmie wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for licenses and renewal of registration

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has been raising pigs to earn a living. Aside from this, she grows vegetables in her garden to earn extra income. She needs to improve her business for her big family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for buying feeds. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase more piglets to raise. Her future plan is to build a piggery shelter where she can keep pigs to raise as an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en: Aljane owns and operates a banana farm to earn a living. She has been helping her husband for six years, and earns well for the family.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. Recently, she took a new loan to cover banana replanting costs. Their farm helps a lot to support their children's education. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover banana replanting costs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married with four children.  She provides transportation services in their village, while her husband works as a carpenter.  The couple plans to improve their house while their children are still young. In the coming years they are going to send them to college. Aside from this, she is also engaged in selling groceries in her retail store. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover maintenance costs for the motorcycle used for transportation and to carry her purchased stocks.  Fe wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs for the motorcycle used for transportation and to carry her purchased stocks.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, two in school and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mwanakombo has operated a cashew nut-selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Patmani

texts.en:
Patmani is a 52-year-old married woman from the village Zeindari in the Vani district. She lives with her husband and son. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They intensively cultivate a vineyard, harvest vegetables, and sell products at the local market. Also, the family owns pigs, which they grow and sell at a good price. 

Patmani's business needs some investment for further development. The family has just started a chicken stall's construction and requested a loan for its completion. The start-up program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Patmani's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $5000 for setting up a poultry farm, breeding chickens, and buying food for them. 

After the the poultry farm forms, the family will get another source of income and increase their living condition. Patmani and her family will be grateful to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm

loans.name: Zvart

texts.en:
Zvart lives in Gusana village with her husband and three children. Zvart is a gatekeeper at the local school and also is engaged in agriculture. She keeps livestock (cows, sheep, chickens and calves) and also cultivates wheat and barley. 
Zvart will be very grateful to lenders if they support with the loan of USD 1500. The loan will be used at purchasing seed, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock and repair the agro machine. This is very important improvement for her farming business and she will be very grateful to lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: to pay for seed, fertilizer, forage for the livestock and repair the agro machine

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is a 56-year-old widowed woman from the village of Tibaani, Georgia.  She lives with her daughter, who is temporarily unemployed. Liana runs agricultural activities and has her own vineyard. She cultivates grapes and sells them locally.  However, Liana can't address all of the financial difficulties as she has only seasonal income, so the family belongs to the subsistence poor category and live in poverty.  She lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit to start her business because they require a stable income and business experience.  The startup loan program created by Kiva and Credo enables Liana to get a loan of 1,200 GEL to start her trading business. She will purchase clothing and bedding at wholesale price and sell it at a good price among her villagers. This business will help Liana to generate income and improve her financial condition. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to live better.

loans.use: to start a business trading clothing and bedding.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is  a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling shoes and handbags. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase shoes and handbags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and handbags for resale

loans.name: Gusein

texts.en:
Gusein is 52 years old and is a married man from the village of Mamkhuti. He lives with his wife and mother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. His wife is a housekeeper. Gusein is a hard-working person and is involved in transportation and also in an agricultural business. In particular he cultivates a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes and beans are grown and these products are traded locally. 

The second activity for Gusein is working on a mini-bus line. He transfers passengers from his district to Baku and gets a service fee. However he is a driver in a private company and is paid only part of what the service actually makes. Gusein wants to make more savings and increase his productivity and decided to purchase his own mini-bus and continue his service. His request was approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

Gusein hopes he will earn a good income and improve the standard of living for his family members.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to transport passengers.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en: Gulnazi, 65, is a widow from Zestaponi city. She lives with her daughter, a baker who gets a monthly income of 200 GEL. Gulnazi works as a cleaner in the public service and has a fixed salary of 145 GEL. She is a hard-working and motivated person and has a will to ensure her and her daughter's life with all needed things. She wants to start other private activities and work in her free time. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo gives a chance to people like Gulnazi to get a loan for starting their own business. She was approved for a loan of 300 USD that she will use to start a trading business. She will purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and then sell the clothes in her community. This additional income will be a great support to Gulnazi and she will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase a clothing inventory so she can start trading.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is a 58-year-old woman from the village of Maghlaki. She only has a son who gets social assistance from local government, as they live under poverty. Lida is involved in an agricultural business, in particular she milks a cow, produces cheese and sells it locally. The family's income is hardly enough to meet their basic needs and pay everyday costs, so Lida decided to expand her agribusiness. With the requested loan of 1,500 GEL she will build a greenhouse, cultivate greens and tomatoes and sell the harvested products. Her application was approved under the start-up program that enables rural poor like Lida to start or re-start businesses. She will gain more income and make a better life for her son. Lida awaits yours support.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is a 38-year-old divorced woman from Kaspi district. She has two school-aged children. Maia does everything for her children's welfare. She works as a waitress at the restaurant and in her free time gets private orders from local people for blanket sewing. She is not satisfied with her achievements, so wants to increase her income. Maia wants to start a trading business, purchasing clothing at wholesale prices and selling it at a good price to her wide community. She thinks that her activity will be profitable and she can save much money. Maia is looking forward to Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 52-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and pensioner parents in the small village of Khoni District. Davit is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 cows, 2 calves, and a pig. David's wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese, which is sold to local markets at a good price. They also sell piglets.

As the income is only seasonal and not enough for the family, David decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $4,000 to purchase a car. Once the car is purchased, David will start a taxi business to serve the local people as a driver. The income of the family will be increased. This will help to cover every day costs and to improve their living conditions. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for a new taxi business.

loans.name: Oktai

texts.en: Oktai is a 44-year-old married man from Marneuli district. He has a wife and 2 school-aged sons. His wife is a homemaker. The only source of the family's income is Oktai's job, working at his friend's workshop as a joiner. In order to increase his monthly income and make his work more productive, Oktai wants to open his own wood workshop, get orders, and work hard himself for his family's financial stability. His request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo; the start-up program gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. He was approved for a loan of 1,500 USD for purchasing machine tools and electrical wiring for the workshop. Oktai appreciates Kiva lenders' support to develop and maintain his business.

loans.use: to purchase machine tools and open his own wood workshop

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 42 years old and an experienced farmer from the village of Nalepsao. He is married and has three children. His wife keeps house and takes care of the children.

Khvicha is intensively engaged in cattle and milk cow breeding and farming grapes and nuts. In a greenhouse he cultivates flowers seasonally. Every harvested product he sells locally.

Khvicha would like to branch out. He is applying for a 2000 GEL loan through Credo to buy machining tools and make chairs. He has experience in such workmanship and will easily sell his chairs locally.

Kvicha and his family are relying on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to buy machining tools to make chairs

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros is a 50-year-old married man from Akhaltsikhe district. He lives with his wife and 2 school-aged children.

The only source of the family's income is Martiros's job working as a dentist. On average he generates 500-600 GEL monthly. As this income isn't enough for the 4-member family, Martiros decided to start an agricultural activity parallel to his everyday work. He has experience cultivating in a greenhouse and wants to repair it, seed vegetables seasonally and then sell them locally.

With the requested loan he also wants to purchase cattle and, after growing them, Martiros will sell at a good price at the local market. This additional income will be a great support for the family and they are looking forward to the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and repair greenhouse

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is 39 years old and a temporarily unemployed woman from Tejola district. She lives with her son and husband, who is an auxiliary worker at this moment and generates 400 GEL (Georgia lari) per month. This income isn't enough to meet all basic needs of family, so they live under poverty. 

Patima wants to increase the family's income and start her own activity. She decided to purchase stock of clothing with the requested loan and start trading. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables rural people to start or restart businesses. She will sell a wide assortment of seasonal clothes among her friends and neighbors. Patima looks forward to Kiva lenders' help and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and start trading

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia is 29 years old, divorced and from the village Vardisubani. She has two children and lives with her parents, who get monthly assistance from local government. The family is slightly involved in agriculture, growing wheat and selling it locally. Natia works as a saleslady at the store and earns a monthly income of 220 GEL. Sometimes she gets products from the store at wholesale prices and sells them among her neighbors. However this income is hardly enough for her five-member family. So, Natia decided to help her father start his own taxi business and generate some income for the family's welfare. With the requested loan she wants to purchase a car and let her father work as taxi driver. This additional income will be great support for her family and they highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her father and start a taxi business

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 45-year-old married man, from the village of Supsa. He lives with his parents, wife, and two school-aged children. Gocha's parents get monthly assistance from the local government. The family runs agricultural activities; in particular they have cattle and cultivate mandarin, nuts, and maize, which are sold locally. 

Because of the lack of economic resources, Gocha wants to start his own private activity. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1000 GEL to open a metal shop. He will serve locals and get private orders. This business will help Gocha to make a better life for his family, increase their income, and create financial stability.

loans.use: To open a metal shop

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en: Tamazi is a 62-year-old experienced farmer from the village Mirzovka in the Marneuli district. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and kindergarten-aged grandson. His son works as a secretary in a private company and monthly generates 400 GEL. For 25 years, Tamazi and his wife have been intensively engaged in cattle breeding, and in cultivating a plot of agricultural land. They sell milk-products and harvested vegetables locally. Tamazi always has high quality and fresh products. This hard-working man wants to create another source of income for his family. His request was approved and with this loan of USD 5000, Tamazi will build a grocery store near his house. He thinks the business will be lucrative due to its good location and the only business in this area. His regular customers will be neighbors and will have stable source of income throughout the year. Tamazi and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful for their help.

loans.use: To build a grocery store

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 42-year-old married man.  He lives with his mother, wife, two sons, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter.  The only source of family income is a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products.  Kakha's wife milks the cow everyday and makes cheese to sell at local markets.  

As the income is not enough for such a large family, Kakha decided to build a greenhouse, as he has land near their house. The startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 5000 gel.  He will purchase all the building materials and will build a greenhouse where the family will grow vegetables. Kakha will also renovate the mill and will take orders to grind the cereals and generate additional income. 

The startup loan program will be a great support for the family. Kakha awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse to grow vegetables and to renovate the mill to grind cereals.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en: Inga, 37, is a married woman from Terjola district. She lives with her son and husband, who works as a auxiliary worker and generates 400 GEL per month. Her son is temporarily unemployed and the only source of family's income is her husband's salary. Inga has a great desire to be involved in her own activity and somehow increase the living condition of her family. She has a plan to sell clothes, so she requested a loan of 170 USD to purchase a stock of clothing and resell it at a good price in her community. This additional income will be significant help for this motivated woman, as it will enable her to be financially independent. Inga is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 52-year-old married woman from Tbilisi city. She lives with her husband, who is an artisan and works on private orders. His monthly salary consists of 500 GEL (Georgia lari). Leila is working as a babysitter for a family. She works a half day and has desire to be involved in another activity. Leila requested a loan for starting a trading business with home products. She will buy products at a wholesale price, and then sell them at a good price in her community. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. This new business will be a great support for this motivated woman. Leila awaits your support.

loans.use: To start trading home products

loans.name: Ambrosi

texts.en: Ambrosi is a 48-year-old married man from the village of Verkhvismindori. He lives with his wife who is a housekeeper that also helps with her husband in his everyday works. Ambrosi is involved in agricultural activities. He cultivates a plot of agricultural land where maize, cucumbers, peppers, and watermelons are grown. He sells these seasonal products locally and on average generates 400 GEL per month. Ambrosi wants to have source of stable income and start another activity. He requested a loan 5,000 USD for purchasing a special tractor that will help Ambrosi to get private orders among his and nearby villages. This new business will be lucrative and will keep him make financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a special tractor.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is a 42-year-old married woman from the village of Shalauri in the Telavi district. She has a big family with seven members and some of them are employed. Ia is a nurse and monthly gets 170 GEL. Ia's son is a taxi driver, and her mother-in-law gets monthly assistance from the  local government. 

Her husband is a driver at a private company and monthly generates 150 GEL. His income will significantly increase with the help of the requested loan. Ia will purchase a special tractor for her husband and it will enable him to get private orders. This business is really profitable in this region and he thinks he could improve the living conditions of family. Ia and her family members rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their help.

loans.use: To purchase special tractor

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en:
Zoia is a 44-year-old widowed woman from the settlement of Tsikhisdziri in the Mtskheta district. She lives with her son, who is temporarily unemployed. 

Zoia works as a cooker at the local restaurant and monthly generates 300-400 GEL. This is the only source of family income. That is hardly enough to meet all basic needs. Zoia requested a loan for new activity. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

Zoia has already rented a place for a store and with the loan of $1200 she will purchase a stock of grocery products. This new business will be a great support for this hard-working woman and her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is a 49-year-old married woman from the village of Khachkovi. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. The family runs agricultural activities; they have milk-cows and Venera sells their products locally. Also Venera and her husband cultivate a plot of agricultural land, grow potatoes, and use it for local trading. 

Venera's son is a musician who plays at events such as weddings. His income is important for the family's welfare, so Venera requested a loan to aid her son's activity. With the loan of 3000 USD she will purchase improved musical instruments to help her son play better and get more orders to play. Venera and her family will be glad and will greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments

loans.name: Daro

texts.en:
Daro is 59 years old. She lives in the Dedoplistskaro district.  She works at a local cafe as a cleaner and gets 260 Gel per month.  Daro decided to start her own additional business and requested a loan.  

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $300 to begin a trading business.  She will purchase clothes to resell among her villagers.  Daro will be able to increase her income and improve her living conditions.  The Start Up program will be a great support for Daro.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 28-year-old married man from Tbilisi city. He has a wife and a school-aged son. His wife works as a call center operator, and generates 400 GEL. Zurab is a distributor at a private company, and gets a fixed salary. 

In order to more effectively meet all the basic needs of the family, Zurab decided to start his own business. 

With the requested loan of 1,200 USD, he will purchase a car and start a taxi business. 

He will serve local people in his free time, and generate more income. This new business will be a great support for this hard-working man and his family, and he will be able to develop it further.

Zurab awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is a 67-year-old widower from the village Zovreti in Zestaponi district. He lives alone and is engaged in agricultural activities. In particular, Givi takes care of milk cows, whose products he sells locally; also, he cultivates a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land where nuts are grown. 

This hard-working man wants to make more savings and to be involved in other stable work. He requested a loan for purchasing a mini-bus to serve local school students. Givi will be a driver on a special school line and will be paid a monthly salary. He will be very grateful for Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to serve local students.

loans.name: Petre

texts.en: Petre is a 46-year-old married man from the village of Apeni, Lagodekhi district. He lives with his wife, 2 school-aged children and mother, who gets a pension from the local government. His wife is a housekeeper and helps Petre with everyday work. He runs agricultural activities, and trades with cultivated vegetables, watermelon and maize. Per month he generates 400 GEL. For further development, Petre's agricultural business needs some investment as he wants to sow more watermelon, purchase fertilizer and repair his greenhouse. With the requested loan he will buy plastic for the greenhouse, harvest more watermelons and get more income. Petre will be grateful for Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon fertilizer and plastic for his greenhouse

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 51-year-old married woman from the village of Urta. Most of her family members live abroad. Her daughter-in-law and two grandsons live with her. Her daughter-in-law is involved in the trading business and has her own income. 

Maia actively works in agricultural activity. She takes care of two cattle and of family-owned agricultural land, where citrus, nuts, and maize are grown. She sells the harvested products locally. 

In order to more effectively meet the daily costs and make a better life for her grandsons, Maia decided to start a trading business with clothing and home products. With the requested loan, she will purchase stock of the mentioned products and then sell them for a good price among her villagers. This additional income will be a great support for this diligent woman and she will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To start trading with clothing and home products

loans.name: Kurban

texts.en: This is Kurban, a 56-year-old male from the village of Vakhtangisi. He lives with his wife, who is a housekeeper. Kurban works hard on his family-owned agricultural land, where he cultivates greens. He sells harvested products locally and earns approximately 350 GEL per month. As the existing income is not enough to meet daily costs and save for his family, Kurban decided to start his own business. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, will enable him to get a loan of $3,200 to purchase a secondhand car. Kurban will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them throughout the city. This credit will offer great support to his family. Kurban is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Raji

texts.en:
Raji is a 50-year-old married man from the village of Akhalsopeli, in the Zugdidi district. The family members get refugee aid from the local government, as they were taken away from their hometown during the war. Raji's mother also gets a pension of 150 GEL per month. This income is the only source of the family's viability and they live in poverty. 

Raji was unable to get a high education, and that's why he couldn't find any state job. He decided to request a loan for starting a taxi business. He will purchase a car with the loan and serve local people. This new activity will be beneficial for Raji, giving his family a chance to live better. Raji and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is a 21-year-old married man from the village of Kartubani. He lives with his wife and grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. 

Dimitri is involved in agricultural activity. His family owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates maize and eggplant seasonally. Dimitri sells these harvested products locally. However, the income from the agricultural business isn't enough for him to handle all the financial difficulties. He decided to start a more stable activity and not depend on only seasonal income. 

With the requested loan, he will start a trading business with toys. He will purchase toys at wholesale prices and then sell them for a good price. With the help of this loan, Dimitri can satisfy his family's increased needs and have savings for further development.

loans.use: to start a trading business with toys.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 40-year-old divorced woman from Telavi city. She lives with her parents and son. Marine's parents get monthly assistance from the local government. The family also has income from a lease, they rent a flat and garage. The total combined income is 500 GEL per month. 

Marine has a great desire to have her own job and do her bit for the family's welfare. She requested a loan to MFO Credo, called start up program, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She was approved the loan for opening a travel agency. Marine has already found a place and has arranged it partially.  Now she needs money to finish the repair work on her agency. 

Marine is very grateful to KIVA lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to have her own business, make a better future for her son, and become financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and pay for repairs to the location of her travel agency

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en: Avtandil is a 56-year-old married man from Tbilisi city. He lives with his wife, daughter and son. Avtandil is self-employed, while his daughter and son both work in sales. Their monthly income is 200 GEL. Avtandil has his own car-coloring service. He receives private orders and is paid individually, based on the type of work.  However, the income isn't stable and depends on the number of orders, so Avtandil decided to start another activity to supplement his income. He requested money to repair his own car and start bread distribution. He will supply stores with bread throughout the city. Avtandil will arrange better living conditions and financial stability for his family, with the help of this new business initiative. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his car and start a bread distribution business.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is a 69-year-old pensioner woman, from the village Nazareni. She has a pensioner husband, a daughter, a son-in-law and 3 grandsons. The family is highly involved in the agricultural business. She obtains income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Makvala's husband helps her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. They take care of 3 cattle and family-owned agricultural land, where they grow nuts, maize and laurel, which are sold locally. This seven-member family needs a loan to tackle all of their financial difficulties. Makvala requested a loan for a trading business. Her daughter will purchase clothing and linens at wholesale prices and then sell them at a good price. This will help the family to make a better living and increase their monthly income.

loans.use: to start trading clothing and linens

loans.name: Vakhtangi

texts.en: Vakhtangi is a 26-year-old young man from Kutaisi city.  He has a wife and two kindergarten-aged children.  His wife works as a cleaner and gets 100 GEL monthly.  In order to pay all daily costs and meet all the basic needs of the family, Vakhtangi needs an activity.  He has no income nowadays, so he requested a loan.  Vakhtangi's application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives him a chance to start his own business.  With the loan of 650 USD he will purchase tools and mounting for a shoe workshop and will start sewing. This business will be lucrative and will be the only business in this area. Vakhtangi and his family rely on the good will of lenders and highly appreciate your help. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To open a shoe workshop

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is a 26-year-old housekeeper from the village of Kakabeti. She lives with her husband, mother and two minor children. Pikria's husband is a baker and monthly generates 400 GEL (Georgia lari). This is the only source of income this five-member family. 

Pikria has a great desire to be involved in her own activity and do her bit to support the family's welfare. She requested a loan of 1,500 GEL for starting a trading business. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. With the mentioned money, she will purchase clothing at a wholesale price and then sell it in her community for a good price. Pikria will generate her own income and will face all the financial difficulties together with her husband. She will be grateful to all Kiva lenders for financing her loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing at a wholesale price to resell

loans.name: Viseli

texts.en:
Viseli is a 67-year-old married woman from Sanavardo village. She lives with her husband, who is an artisan and gets private orders for home repairs. He generates 300 GEL monthly. Viseli is pension-aged and gets monthly assistance from the local government.

She has a great desire to generate her own income and to be involved herself in an agricultural activity. Viseli requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved with the start-up program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan, she will purchase cattle and, after growing them, she will sell for a good price. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program, Viseli will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela is 56 years old and is a widow woman from Bolnisi city. She has two sons and a grandson. Her son is disabled, deaf-and-dumb and gets a suitable pension. The family lives in poverty and the local government pays them social assistance each month. Anjela is a hard-working woman who does everything for her family's welfare. She works at a store as a sales lady and also trades privately in clothing; each month she generates 400-500 GEL. 

Anjera finds it hard to meet all her financial requirements with the help of this income only and wants to start another activity also. She requested a loan so she can open her own grocery store, in a place that she has already rented. She will purchase a stock of needed products and open the store. This additional income will be a great support for Anjela, as she can get save more money and achieve financial stability. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of needed products to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Jambul

texts.en:
Jambul is 46 years old and is a married man from Batumi city. He has a wife and two infants. His wife is a hospital nurse and generates 400 GEL monthly. Jambul is involved in a distribution business; he works in a private company and is paid according to the work he does. 

Jambul wants to face all his financial difficulties more effectively and start his own activity also. He requested a loan to purchase a car so he can start a taxi business. This activity will be an additional source of income for this hard-working man. He will serve locals in his free time and make more savings. 

Jambul and his family will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is a 46-year-old man, from the village of Sameba. He lives with his wife, daughter and son, who works as a waiter in the local restaurant. Temur doesn't have his own source of income and has great desire to do his bit for the family's welfare. 

He requested a loan of 3,500 USD and was approved within the start-up program, that enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. Temur wants to purchase a mini-bus and work on a special line. This business will be a huge support for his family, as they could better face all financial difficulties and improve their living conditions. Temur is thankful to all Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus and work on a special line.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is a 60-year-old married man from Batumi city. He lives with his housekeeper wife, and it's already for two years that he has provided intercity taxi service. Rezo generates 600 GEL (Georgia lari) per month, but his business needs some investment for further development. His car has become antiquated, and Rezo requested a loan for the purchase of a new car. He will continue serving his customers with the new car and get more orders. 

His application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or restart businesses. Rezo will improve his activity and generate more money for his family's increased needs.

loans.use: To change his car and provide taxi service

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 55-year-old widowed woman. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with her two sons. One of her sons is provided with an invalid pension from the government of 150 Gel per month. 

Leila owns a commercial space that is rented out. She needs $2,000 to renovate the commercial space and rent it out at a better price. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family. Their income will be increased and Leila will provide better living conditions for the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a commercial space and rent it out at a better price.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 37 years old and is from the village Sharabidzeebi, Georgia. She is married and has two school-aged children. Tea's husband is a truck driver and makes 400 GEL a month.

Tea always wanted to have her own business, so one month ago she opened a used clothing store. She is applying for a 600 USD loan through CREDO to buy more clothing to add to her store’s inventory. She plans on having a wide assortment of clothing for women, men and children.

With the help of this loan Tea will be able to save more and make her business more profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to add to her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Keto

texts.en:
Keto is a 60-year-old married woman, from Tbilisi city. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. The male members of the family are involved in house repair activities. They get private orders and monthly generate 400 GEL. Keto's daughter-in-law is an office manager and has her own income. 

Keto is a housekeeper and has great desire to be financially independent. She requested a loan to open a sewing workshop and this request was  approved with the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Keto will purchase sewing machines and tools and will get clients. She will also renovate the place. This new business will be great support for Keto, enable her to have her own income and do her bit for the family's welfare.

loans.use: To open a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en: Nanuli who is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the village of Napareuli. She lives alone and is involved in the trading business. In addition, she sells fruits and vegetables and generates 150-200 GEL monthly. She also takes care of her nephew, and this income isn't enough for her to meet all daily costs and also make savings for her future goals. Nanuli wants to start her own private activity and requested a loan. The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to start a business. Nanuli will open a bakery: she will rent a place and bake traditional bread. This business will increase her income and helps Nanuli to meet all her financial difficulties effectively.

loans.use: to open a traditional Georgian bakery

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is a 42-year-old married woman from Batumi city. She lives with her husband, daughter and grandson. Nowadays, the only source of the family's income is Irma's daughter's job. She works as a waiter and monthly gets 400 GEL. Irma had her own business during the summer. She opened a cafe and had good yields. Considering that season has gone and Irma wants a stable income to meet all daily costs, she decided to start a similar activity, but not seasonal. She requested a loan for opening a cafe at the center of the city. Irma has already found a place and needs money for renovating it. She will be involved in the cafe's everyday work. This new business will give Irma a chance to make financial stability for her family and to get a monthly income. She looks forward to help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to open a cafe.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 52 years old woman, from village Sairkhe. She lives with her husband, son, and mother-in-law, who gets a monthly assistance from the local government. The family is involved in agricultural activity, in particular they cultivate a plot of agricultural land where they harvest grapes and sell them seasonally.

In order to more effectively meet all financial responsibilities Nino wants to expand her agribusiness. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. Nino will purchase cattle and pigs, breed them and after they're grown she will sell at a good price locally. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and pigs

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is a 26-year-old young woman from the Kvareli district of Georgia. She lives with her parents, both of whom receive 150 GEL monthly from age-related pension. Tamari is a hard-working and diligent person, who works as a baker at a traditional Georgian bakery. The income she generates comes to 330 GEL per month.

Tamari wants to address the family's financial difficulties by starting a new business, and she was approved for a loan of 1600 GEL to start a business selling lingerie. She will purchase products at wholesale prices and then sell them for a profit in her community. This will give her a chance to earn more income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program of which this loan is a part, Tamari will be able to start saving money and provide better future for her family.

loans.use: to start a business selling lingerie.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 65 years old and temporarily unemployed.  She lives in the Chiatura district with her husband, who gets an age pension from the local government. 

Anna had been involved in a trading business for 7 years, but her business ended for lack of economic resources. Her business needs some capital to reach it's goal. Anna requested a loan with MFO Credo, the start-up program enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $600 USD she will purchase linens and blankets in Turkey and will sell locally at a good price. 

Anna and her husband rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to start trading with linens and blankets

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 64-year-old pensioned woman, from the village Sormoni. She lives with her two sons, one of whom one is involved in wood sales. He generates approximately 150 GEL per month. 

Lili takes care of two cows and a plot of agricultural land, where she seasonally harvests grapes. Lili wants to invest more money in order to become more effective in her agricultural activity. She requested a loan 700 GEL to purchase a milk cow, produce dairy products, and sell them locally. 

The start-up program enables people like Lili to start or re-start businesses. This new business will be great support for this hard-working woman, as she can improve her monthly income and somehow achieve financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 42 years old and temporarily unemployed. She lives with her husband and 2 school-aged children in Chiatura district. The only source of income for this family of four is Lela's husband's job, which is working at the mane. He only has 400 GEL per month in order to meet the family's basic needs. 

Lela has a great desire to start her own activities to meet her family's needs. She has requested a loan of 750 USD to start a trading business in clothing. She will purchase a stock of clothing in Turkey at wholesale prices and then sell the clothes in her community. With the help of this activity, Lela will do her bit to improve her family's welfare and avoid financial difficulty. She looks forward to her Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of clothing to start trading

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka is a 43-year-old married woman from the village of Jalaurta. She has a husband, a daughter and a son, who lives abroad. Eka and her husband are engaged in pig and milked-cows breeding and in cultivating family-owned agricultural land. They always have high quality products and have their own customers. This hard-working couple has now requested a loan to start trading on a larger scale. Eka's husband will purchase a mini-bus and they will take their products to the capital of Georgia to sell them at a good price. Also, Eka will bring products from there that will be consumable in her village and will sell them to generate a profit. The family relies on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start trading.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 58-year-old married woman from the village of Tsknori. She lives with her husband and two sons. One of her sons is unemployed, and the other one works with his father. Together they generate 700 GEL monthly.

Tina is extensively engaged in agricultural businesses. She breeds milk cows, raises cattle and pigs, and cultivates a plot of land. She sells dairy products and grapes locally. She works really hard on her business activities and wants to increase her family's income. Tina requested a loan and was approved through the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the requested money she will purchase a tractor so that her son can work on carrying out wood from forests. He will do this work legally and sell the wood in his and nearby villages. This activity will bring significant income to the family and will improve their living conditions. Tina awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine is 27-year-old married woman from the village Gogolesubani. She lives with her husband and his family. The main source of the family's income is from agricultural activity. They cultivate a plot of family owned agricultural land, where maize and nuts are grown; also Kristine takes care of cattle and milk-cows. The obtained products are sold locally. However this mentioned income isn't enough to meet all basic needs, so Kristine decided to request a loan for starting new activity. She was approved with the loan 2800 USD to open a car wash, where her husband will work and the family will get stable income. With support of the Start Up program Kristine and her family will get an opportunity to be involved in their own business and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a car wash

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is a 54-year-old married woman from the village of Vejini. She lives with her husband and son, who works as a car artisan and gets 400 GEL monthly. Naili and her husband are extensively engaged in the cultivation of grapes and peaches. Naili takes care with the family-owned vineyard and her husband sells the agricultural produce in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

For further development her business needs some investment. Naili requested a loan from MFO Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will purchase special saplings for grapes and will plant them in her land. With the help of this new variety of grapes, the family will sell their produce at a good price and generate more income. Naili relies on the goodwill of lenders and awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase special saplings for grapes

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is a 34-year-old woman from the village of Likhauri. She lives with her parents and all the family members are involved in agricultural activities. Nino works hard on family-owned land, where she cultivates nuts and maize. She also has one milking cow, whose products are sold locally. However, the income isn't enough for Nino to solve all their financial difficulties. She requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved with the start-up program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. Nino will start a trading business with the requested money. She will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will sell them at a good price at the local market. Nino is a motivated and hardworking woman with a great desire to provide financial stability for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is 41 years old woman from Kaspi district. She lives with her two sons. Tamar works as a sick-nurse and gets small monthly income, which is not enough to cover everyday costs.
