She decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 300 to start a trading business. Tamar will go to Turkey and will purchase clothes and then she will resell them among her villagers. Tamar is very motivated and is ready to tackle all the difficulties while starting new business. She plans to expand the business in future and get orders from people. Tamar awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in clothes

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 47-year-old widowed woman, from the village, Khibula. She has two unemployed sons only. The family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category since they don't have any significant income and live under poverty. 

Nino works hard in her agricultural activity. She is involved in cattle and pig-breeding, milking the cow, cultivating a plot of agricultural land, and growing nuts and laurel. Nino sells the products in her region's market. She can't remove all financial difficulties with the help of these activities, so she wants to start another business. 

In particular, with the requested money, Nino will start a trading business, with clothing and curtains. Nino will buy products at wholesale prices and she will sell them for an increased price. This loan will be a huge support for this hard-working woman and her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a trading business, with clothing and curtains.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 44 years old and a married woman from Gori city. She has a husband, a daughter who is a student, and a school-aged son. Asmat's husband is temporarily unemployed and the only source of the family's income is Asmat's job, working as a saleslady. Monthly, she generates 240 GEL. It's clear that only this income isn't enough for a four-member family that continuously has increased needs. 

Asmat decided to improve their living conditions somehow and requested a loan for her husband so he can be involved in his own business. Her application was approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives people a chance to start or restart businesses.

 Asmat will use the requested money for renting a stall in the local market, purchasing a stock of car spare parts, and starting trading. Her husband will head up all activities related to this business. The income from this source will be great help for the family so they rely on the goodwill of lenders.

loans.use: To start selling automobile spare parts

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 21-year-old young married woman from the village of Teklati. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and father-in-law, who works as bodyguard and generates 300 GEL monthly. Nana's husband is an plumbing artisan and also gets 300 GEL per month. Nana couldn't receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements for business experience or stable revenue, until the start-up program that is a joint product of Kiva and Credo began. The program allows rural poor like Nana to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. She requested a loan of 600 USD to begin trading with clothing and other home products. She plans to go to the capital and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Because of the start-up program Nana will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: To start a trading business with clothing and home products

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 38-year-old married woman from the village of Nosiri. She has a son and husband, who is on contract in the national army and gets 950 GEL (Georgis lari) monthly. This is the only source of income for family, and they find it hard to overcome all financial difficulties with this income. 

Nona decided to do her bit for the family's welfare and start her own activity. She requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved for $500 USD for purchasing a stock of home products and clothing at wholesale prices to resell at a good price locally. Nona will generate her own income and become financially independent. She looks forward to Kiva lenders' help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start a home products and clothing business

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a 53-year-old woman, from the village Khodasheni. She lives with her son, brother and daughter-in-law. Marine and her son are involved in agricultural activities. For 7 years they have worked as hired workers in the private sector. The family also owns 2 milk cows, whose products are sold locally. They cultivate strawberries and peaches as well. They have a hired horse, with which they can get wood from the forest and bring it to the village. As you can see, Marine and her son really work hard in order to meet all of the basic needs of the family. However, they live in poverty and need some investment for further development. Marine requested money for starting a new business. In particular, she will purchase a stock of clothing and gift products at wholesale prices and will start trading. This new business initiative will help her generate more income and more effectively meet their daily costs. Marine is looking forward to your help.

loans.use: To start trading clothing and other gift items.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 27-year-old, married woman from the village, Dercheli. She has a husband and an infant. The only employed person in the family is Teona, who works at a kindergarten and generates 90 GEL per month. It's clear that this income isn't enough for a three member-family to meet all its basic needs, especially when one is an infant. 

Teona wants to improve her income and start a parallel activity in her free time. She requested a loan and was approved with the start-up program that enables rural people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan, she will purchase a machine for manufacturing enamelware. She will make a wide assortment of enamel accessories and will sell them locally, at a good price. With the help of this business, she will be able to pay some daily costs and improve the family's living conditions. 

Teona will be grateful and she greatly appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for manufacturing enamelware.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 40 years old and a divorced woman, from the village of Tandzia, in Bolnisi district. She lives with her parents, daughter and son, who is a student. The daughter is school-aged, and her parents get a pension from the local government.

Nana works hard on family-owned agricultural land, cultivating the land and taking care of the milked-cow. She sells her agricultural products locally, and generates some income. She has a great desire to start another activity, in order to more effectively meet all the basic needs of her family and lead them in dealing with their financial difficulties.

With the requested loan money, she will purchase a tractor and make it work on private orders. Nana will get additional significant income from this activity, and will improve the living conditions of her family. She will be grateful for the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en: Tsisana is a 50 year-old married woman from the village of Rokiti. She lives with her daughter, son, and husband, who works as a builder in construction and monthly generates 400 GEL.  Tsisana's daughter is a hospital nurse and gets a small income per month. Tsisana works hard on family-owned agricultural land, cultivates a vineyard, takes care of milking cows and cattle. She sells the farm products locally.  Tsisana wants to make an investment for further development in her agricultural business and requested a loan. Her application was approved with the start up program that enables people to start or restart businesses. She will use the money for setting up a greenhouse and cultivating seasonal products there. Tsisana hopes she will earn a good income and improve the standard of living for her family members in the near future.

loans.use: To set up a greenhouse

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 29 years old and is a young married woman from the village of Sazano in the Zestaponi district. She lives with her husband, sister-in-law, and two school-aged daughters. Ketevan's husband is an artisan, and he gets private orders and generates approximately 300 GEL a month. Her sister-in-law is disabled and gets an invalid pension monthly. 

Ketevan is involved in agricultural activities, in particular she takes care of milking cows and cattle and cultivates a plot of agricultural land. However, her family's income is hardly enough to meet all of her basic needs, and Ketevan has desires to somehow improve her family's living conditions. 

With the requested money, she will purchase a special tractor and make her husband work at private orders. This business is really profitable and will highly increase their income. Ketevan and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a special tractor.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en: Shorena is a 32-year-old divorced woman, from Manglisi borough. She has 2 school-aged daughters and has no income to take care her family's basic needs. The family lives under poverty and as it becomes harder for Shorena to earn a living, she requested a loan. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. Shorena decided to start a trading business with used clothing. She will purchase a stock of wide assortment clothing and will sell locally from her house. This new business will be a huge support for Shorena and her 2 daughters, as they can get a source of some income for satisfying their basic needs. Shorena will be grateful for all your help and will appreciate it.

loans.use: To start trading business with used clothing

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz is a 56-year-old woman. She lives in Kutaisi district, West Georgia. Gulnaz is unemployed now; she has no source of income and lives in poverty. According to above-mentioned situation, Gulnaz lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Gulnaz to get a loan of $1,000 to start a trading business. She will purchase a stock of used clothes and begin her trading business. She will have a stable income, which will enable her to cover everyday costs, as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the Start Up program, Gulnaz will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of used clothes to begin her trading business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 35-year-old married woman from Batumi. She lives with her husband and kindergarten-aged son. Diana's husband is a goldsmith and his monthly income is 500 GEL. 

Diana has just rented a place in the local jewelry market. She has some gold and silver jewelry to sell and wants to expand her jewelry assortment. She requested a loan and was approved by the startup program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

With the requested money, she will purchase additional stocks of jewelry and start her retail business. She will help her husband to sell the items he makes and generate her own income. 

Diana and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law in Marneuli district. Her husband serves local people as a taxi driver with his car. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension from government institutions. Naila is unemployed, and she decided to start an agricultural business. She requested a loan from the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo  and enables her to get a loan of 2500 Gel. With the received credit, Naila plans to purchase two calves, seeds and fertilizers. The family owns a small plot of agricultural land, where Naila will raise some vegetables. She will also raise calves and will start producing dairy products. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 42 years old and a married woman from village Dzevri. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. Both family members get monthly assistance from local government. The only profitable activity for her family is Irma's job, working as a music teacher. She teaches children in her home and is paid approximately 300 GEL monthly. Irma wants to increase her income and more effectively meet daily costs. With the requested money, she will open a grocery store and will purchase the needed products. This new business will be profitable as it will be the only business in this area. Irma will provide for local people's everyday needs and other home products. She relies on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en: Natela, 68 years old, is from Batumi city, in western Georgia. She lives with her two sons and pensioned sister. One of her sons works at the Ministry of Agriculture and earns 800 GEL monthly. Natela works at a folk art school and gets a fixed salary. In order to increase her family's income, Natela requested a loan and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. She will use the requested money to repair a house and then rent it. The city where she lives has a great location, since it is bordered by the Black Sea, and has many tourists seasonally. Natela will rent the house at a good price to generate more income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair a house and then rent it

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in the small village of Ozurgeti district with her son and pensioner mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. Rusudan and her son work hard to ensure a good harvest.

Rusudan decided to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a cow. As the cow is purchased, she will start producing cheese products and selling them at the local markets. 

Rusudan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: Dodo is 59 years old. She lives in Batumi, seaside of Georgia. Dodo runs a cafe and needs money to renovate it. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,500, which she will use to renovate the cafe as well as the stock of products. She serves her clients with pleasure and tries to offer them a wide assortments of products.

loans.use: to renovate a cafe and purchase a stock of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en: Ketevan is a 25-year-old married woman from Telavi city. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, father-in-law and two infants. The only source of income for this six-member family is Ketevan's and her husband's joint activity. They buy different kinds of food, cosmetic products and resell them locally. Ketevan's husband distributes products throughout the district. However, the income isn't enough to pay all daily costs of this large family, especially because they have two infants. Ketevan needs your help in renting a place, bringing in purchased products and opening a grocery store. This will be a huge support for her and her hardworking husband. They rely on your goodwill and are awaiting your support.

loans.use: to rent a place and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia is a 32-year-old, hard-working woman from the village, Shalauri. She lives with her husband and two infants. Ia's husband is private worker, who generates income from physical work. Ia gets some private orders of blanket sewing and generates 200 GEL approximately. However the family income isn't enough to meet all basic needs and daily costs, so this motivated woman decided to be involved in agricultural activity and somehow increase income. Ia's request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which helps people to start or re-start businesses. With the mentioned money, she will purchase a milking  cow and cattle, sell its products locally. For the future, she will increase the livestock. This activity will help her increase her living condition sufficiently. Ia awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and cattle.

loans.name: Safet

texts.en:
Safet is a single young man living with his parents and brother in a minority community. They live in a very small, old house, in the same poor conditions as all Ashkali people do. Safet is the only one in his family who works on a consistent basis, supporting his elderly parents and brother. 

Although Safet has a brother who lives in Switzerland and sometimes sends the family money, his brother is not always working and not able to help or contribute, so Safet works all day long as a salesman in a supermarket in order to provide all of the income for them to live on. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to replace the doors and windows in the house. This will help to insulate the home better, keeping the heat in and the cold weather out. Safet is very happy for this opportunity and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for the house

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver is married, 32 years old and the father of two young girls, ages 8 months and 2 years old. They live in a village along with his elderly parents. Like many of the people in his village, he works in agriculture, planting and harvesting his land and the land of others for a fee. 

Enver enjoys what he does because he does not think it is stressful and would not want to change his job, even though he works very hard to support his family and his parents. His brother who lives in Germany sometimes sends them some money to help support them, but Enver is the primary source of income. 

At this time, Enver is in need of a loan in order to purchase a spray pump for his tractor and other supplies. He will use the pump for spraying the land before he can plant. The equipment will help him to become faster and more effective, generating more money and being able to work for more people in a short period of time. 

He really appreciates the help and looks forward to continuing his work in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a spray pump for his tractor and other supplies.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
This group is called Paradise.  It consists of four members who live in the same area in Dansoman-Accra. The group is into the sale of second-hand clothing, diapers, provisions, underwear and watermelon. They are asking for a total loan amount of GHS 2,700 to improve their businesses from ID-Ghana (Kiva's Partner). 

Kwasi, a 35-year-old single man, has been working at the market selling second-hand clothing for six years. He started his business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase his sales volume in order to increase his profit and raise more capital. He has requested a loan to purchase a bale of second-hand clothing to sell to customers. 

Kwasi hopes to expand his business to live comfortably. He, along with his group members, are very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver has six adult children, four girls and two boys. At age 62, he still works in a primary school and continues to work on his land, planting potatoes and wheat, which he enjoys very much. Very soon he will begin receiving a pension, which he is not happy about since the pensions are very low in Kosovo. 

One of his sons is married and lives with his family all together in the same house, as do Enver and his other children. This is helpful since the sons all assisted Enver in his agricultural business when they could not find jobs. 

Enver would like to increase the production of his crops, and requested a loan to buy guano and seeds in order to ensure his crops are successful. This will allow him to have more food and supplies for his family, as well as being able to sell to others; and with a large family, it will save him money. In this way, they can continue to earn a living despite the low income from the pension. Enver appreciates the help and support for his family.

loans.use: To buy guano and seeds in order to ensure his crops are successful

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en:
Kumrije is very thankful to Kiva lenders for all of their help they have provided to her in the past. She has borrowed twice now for her fruit business and has been very satisfied with the results of the loans. 

Kumrije used the first loan to purchase an irrigation machine to increase the yield of her crops and, therefore, be able to plant, harvest, and sell more fruit. She used the second loan to build a storage house to keep the fruits after she picks them, until they are sold. Since she was able to produce and sell more, and at a higher rate because she was able to store them without them turning bad quickly, she was able to increase her profits and provide a better standard of living for her family. 

Now, Kumrije is asking, once again, for a loan for her same business, to purchase materials that will protect the fruits from animals and other harmful threats. She has really managed to improve her family’s conditions and she is always very thankful for the lenders!

loans.use: to purchase materials that will protect the fruits from animals and other harmful threats.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is a 63-year-old, married father of five adult children living in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. Two of his sons work in Western Europe. All of the girls are married. He lives with his wife and with one of his sons, who is married and working as a security guard with a very small salary.

In the community where Sabri lives, most of the people are engaged in agriculture as a primary way to earn a living, just as Sabri always has been. Even though he always dreamed of raising chickens, he was never able to begin this because of the lack of money. Now, Sabri has decided that he would like to start a new aspect of agriculture, raising chickens and selling both chickens and eggs in the market. The loan will help him to build a chicken coop for keeping the chickens and being able to care for them. 

Sabri is both excited and optimistic about this new venture, and as he is hardworking and enjoys the agricultural business, he thinks he will be successful. In the future, he would like to increase his flock and continue to grow his business. He really appreciates the help of the lenders for making his dream come true.

loans.use: To build a chicken coop for keeping the chickens and being able to care for them

loans.name: Xhenifa

texts.en:
Xhenifa, at 20 years old, is recently married and already a mother of a 2-year-old son. She lives with her son and husband under very poor living conditions and works hard to support her husband in his taxi business, helping him to keep his vehicle clean and comfortable for passengers. She even will travel with him at times to help collect money from customers. 

She does these things to help save them money and refrain from paying others for these services, and she does it all while still taking care of their home and son. She works hard to help make improvements for their living conditions. 

Recently, the vehicle has needed to have some repairs done to it, and Xhenifa is requesting a loan in order to pay the costs to change the engine and pay for the labor needed to fix it. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders and will continue to work hard to help her husband grow his business.

loans.use: To pay for the costs to change the taxi engine and pay for the labor needed to fix the vehicle

loans.name: Shefki

texts.en:
Shefki is 47 years old, married, and a father of four children. His children are between the ages of two and eight years old and the two oldest are currently attending school. As with most people living in this area, the family is very poor and he has to work extremely hard to make a basic living. 

Shefki cuts wood and sells it in the community for heating during the winter time. He is not satisfied with the income he gets from this job since he is not able to fully support his family with the money it generates. 

Therefore, he is planning on starting a new business as a taxi driver since he already owns a vehicle and he believes that this kind of business will bring in more income that will be enough to provide for his family and improve their living conditions. 

In order to do so, Shefki will need a loan to register his vehicle, so that he can legally begin to take customers. He really appreciates the help and promises to pay on-time.

loans.use: to register his vehicle as a taxi, so that he can legally begin to take customers.

loans.name: Arton

texts.en:
Arton is a married father with a 3-year-old daughter living in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. In order to earn a living and provide everything possible for his family, he cuts wood and sells it to others for heating, while his wife stays at home taking care of their daughter and the home.

At this time, Arton is in need of a loan in order to renovate his house, specifically the roof and insulation, because everything gets wet when the rain and snow start, which also can create mold and poor health conditions for his family. He is very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan as he has the chance to improve his family's living conditions and have a healthier environment, since all he really wants is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his roof and insulation because everything gets wet when the rain and snow start

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikola lives in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. He is 24 years old and married. He works as a waiter in a restaurant, and his wife does administration work, which makes them very fortunate and lucky, as they live in an area with an extremely high unemployment rate and high level of poverty.  

In addition, he works in the agricultural sector, as he owns two hectares of land. He plants and harvests wheat and corn, which he then sells to generate more income. He is very satisfied with this work and having the opportunity to provide even additional income for his family, since the salaries that he and his wife receive are low. 

Nikolla requested a loan 1,400 Euros for the first time in order to buy new working tools for his tractor. He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy new working tools for his tractor.

loans.name: Marko

texts.en:
Marko is a 21-year-old student who is still single and living with his entire family. He lives with his parents and married brother in an area where the unemployment rate is very high and the majority of the population lives under very poor conditions after being destroyed in the war and unable to rebuild. 

Marko’s mother works in the kitchen of a restaurant and his father is on local TV. At 21, Marko is a very hard worker who likes his construction job and is proud to contribute to his family’s needs. His salary is much needed by the family since like most people living in Kosovo, the salaries are very low and the cost of living is high. Because of this, the family has not been able to façade and insulates their house as all the money needs to go to living on a daily basis or for some other type of unexpected emergency. 

It has been unfortunate that they could not save money for such an important standard of living. In an effort to help create a healthier and more comfortable living environment, Marko is requesting a loan to façade and insulate the house, which will also save them money on the heating costs in the winter.  He appreciates all of the help from the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate and insulate his house

loans.name: Armend

texts.en:
Armend is 20 years old, single, and lives with his entire family. He is very hard working and ambitious, even at this young age, and he is the main source of income for his family. Although he works in an auto mechanic shop, the salary is very low and he must also work in agriculture in order to maintain a decent income to provide for his family. 

Armend raises goats and would also like to expand his farm and purchase several cows as well. Being ambitious, he has been able to make a deal with some companies that will sell his milk and the milk products he makes from the cows he will acquire. He is very positive and optimistic that this expansion of his business will be successful and generate much more income. He is aware that without the loan he will never be able to get the cows and start contracts with these milk companies. He is able to envision a bright future for himself, including being able to be married and have a family. He thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Misin

texts.en:
Misin is very thankful to all of the Kiva lenders for the previous loan. He was very happy to have the opportunity to repair his wood cutting machine, which has helped him to improve his business dramatically because he has now been able to meet the higher level of demands for wood at a quicker pace. Through his work he helps his family and gives them everything they need so he is excited to have the possibility of getting a second loan in order to purchase more tools that are used to prepare the wood for sale. 

He will continue with the same business as he considers it to be very profitable and has been able to continue to grow his business so far. He is grateful for the chance to improve their living conditions and have healthy food. He promises to pay again on time.

loans.use: To purchase more tools that are used to prepare the wood for sale

loans.name: Shukrije

texts.en:
Shukrije, 59, is widow.  She has three adult children: two boys and one girl who are able to help out and work as well. 

One some works in the kitchen of a restaurant and the other in construction.  Shukrije owns cows.  When her husband passed away she was forced to sell one of the cows to generate income and now needs a loan to purchase a new cow. 

Shukrije uses the milk and milk products for her family and she sells the rest to her neighborhood for income.  She hopes that the loan will help her improve her living conditions and give her some distraction from her grief. 

Shukrije promises to pay on time and in full.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Armend

texts.en:
Armend, at the young age of 26, is already the father of three children between the ages of 1 month and 5 years old. His wife takes care of the children and their home in the southern part of Kosovo, while he is working as a welder with iron. He is very professional and works very fast and efficiently, gaining much popularity and many repeat customers. 

Armend has worked in this field for over seven years now. He gained his experience for the first four years by working for someone else and, in the last three years, by working for himself independently. His main projects and business include making different types of iron products for private companies and individuals. He really enjoys his work and is satisfied with the income he generates. 

Since this business is the main source of income for his family, Armend is requesting a loan to purchase new tools and raw materials to improve his current business and expand it as well. This will allow him to increase his profits and, therefore, his family's standard of living and quality of life. He is very grateful to the lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and raw materials to improve his current welding business and expand it as well

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace the doors and windows as they are old and allow much of the cold and the wind to enter the home

loans.name: Boajan

texts.en:
Boajan is 33 years old, married, and the father of 2 schoolchildren, ages 8 and 10 years old. Although he lives in an area where unemployment is very high, he is very fortunate that he and his wife are both able to work and earn a living. He has been a photographer for more than 6 years now, and his wife is a nurse in a clinic. He is very talented and gifted in his chosen field, and he loves it very much. 

Boajan is very creative with his photography and videography, especially at weddings and other special occasions. At the beginning of his career, he started with a very small amount of equipment and very few customers. Since then, he has been able to expand his business, and he now has 2 different types of good cameras, more tools for enhancing his services, and even an advanced machine.

Boajan is requesting a loan in order to purchase a machine that will allow him make photos instantly at events so he can sell them to people on the spot. He believes that people will be very happy to have the photos immediately and will pay more for this type of service. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and add a marketing department that will produce brochures, leaflets, and other printed media. Boajan is very thankful to all lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making instant photos at events

loans.name: Nemanja

texts.en:
Nemanja is 25, engaged to be married, and living with his fiancée. He is a very hard worker who does much to earn a living. He has a very independent spirit that motivates him and drives him to work hard for himself. Nemanja is working in a hotel as a waiter, and his fiancée is working in sales in a local market. 

The home that the couple lives in is very old and in need of renovations in order for them to live comfortably. The loan that Nemanja is requesting will be used to complete the facade of the house, providing better insulation and a cleaner living environment. Since he is planning on being married very soon, he is very thankful to the lenders for this opportunity to get his home in order so that he can start a family and provide a good future for them. Nemanja plans on getting a better job as well so that he can provide a stable and secure income.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en:
Gordana is a 41-year-old married mother of two older children, aged 15 and 19, who are both students in school. Although she works as a nurse and her husband does administration work in a municipality, as well as performing for celebrations and events such as weddings during the summer time for extra income, their salaries are still too low to manage to save money to repair their roof. The costs associated with school are very high and meeting the family’s daily needs is difficult in itself. 

Gordana has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 Euros (EUR) to repair their roof and pay for the labor costs. She is very happy to have the opportunity to improve her family’s living conditions and is relieved to have a chance to finally pay for it.

loans.use: to repair the roof and pay for the labor costs

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is 52 and a married father of four older children between the ages of 13 and 17 years, all attending school. In order to earn a living, Naser works as a taxi driver while his wife works as a cleaner. Currently they live in a very old house, which is in urgent need of renovations and has needed them for years now. 

Naser needs to change the doors and complete some general renovations in order to make his home comfortable and healthier for them. Naser has always wanted to be able to complete these renovations but has not been able to save the money to do it and be able to provide for his family. He is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders for helping him to improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to change the doors and complete general renovations of his house

loans.name: Besa

texts.en:
Besa is married and at 34, is a mother to three young boys. She loves her children very much and loves to spend her time being near them and raising them. For this reason, she considers herself very lucky to be able to make handicrafts from her home to sell, which allows her to take care of the children and her home at the same time. Her husband works in construction, but he has a very low salary. It is for this reason that the longstanding problem with their bathroom has not been addressed, as they have not been able to save money to fix it. Now she is asking for a loan to purchase a water heater and complete other essential renovations to make a more sanitary and healthier environment to raise her children in. 

She hopes that this loan will improve the health of the entire family since her goal is always to improve their living conditions and provide a safe and healthy place to live. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a water heater and complete other essential renovations to make a more sanitary and healthier environment to raise her children in

loans.name: Shqipe

texts.en:
Shqipe is a single 26-year-old woman who lives with her parents in the southern part of Kosovo. She works very hard and often to contribute to her family and satisfy the needs of her parents. She works in a factory while her father works as a guard.  One of the ways she wants to contribute to her family is that she would like to renovate the rooms in the house that have been damaged for a long time and are often cold and grow mold. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 Euros to complete these renovations and create a healthy living environment. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity to take care of her parents' health and address a longstanding problem in their home. She is also hoping to be able to save money in the future so that she can get married and start a family of her own.

loans.use: to renovate her house and create a healthy living environment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  complete the roof on his new house

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije is 29 years old, married and has 2 children ages 1.5 and 3 years old. She works as a cashier in a market while her husband works in construction. Even though they both enjoy employment, it is not enough money for them to meet all of the their family needs on a daily basis. Since they come from a village that many are traditionally engaged in agriculture, they have also been involved in this type of business for a long time to supplement their income. They have a cow that they use for her family’s dairy consumption, helping to save on costs, and plant wheat and corn on the land that they own. 

Now Sanije is requesting a loan in order to purchase the tools for her machine used to work their land. Because their machine and tools are in need of repair, she has not been able to work on her land and receive the benefits associated with it. She knows that with this loan she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions again.

loans.use: To purchase the tools for her machine  to work their land

loans.name: Valbone

texts.en:
Valbona is a 42-year-old married mother of two sons and two daughters between the ages of 12 and 18 years old. Valbona has been able to work from her home making handicrafts for customers who place orders, while her husband works as a taxi driver in order to earn a living and provide for his family. He loves his job very much and is quite popular in his area due to his work ethic and attitude. 

Both Valbona and her husband are happy that they are able to provide any income for their family, as unemployment rates are usually very high. Despite their good fortune of both having work, they are still very poor and live in bad conditions. Their house is very damaged and in need of some general renovations to make it more comfortable and livable for their family. 

Valbona is requesting a loan so that she can improve the living conditions of her family, since without this help she would not be able to do so. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Jovica

texts.en:
Jovica is 60 years old and although he is the father of two adult sons who are married, he lives only with his wife. For the last ten years he has worked with metals in a small shop, which started out as a hobby and then became his profession after much success and realizing the income potential he had from it. 

Typically Jovica makes trailers for vehicles and tractors based on the customer need and input. He is very popular and has many demands for his work from all over Kosovo. Now he is in need of more materials and tools for his trailer work as his client base continues to grow. He believes that the loan will help him to improve his business and increase his income even more. He promises to pay punctually and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his work as his client base continues to grow

loans.name: Safet

texts.en:
Safet has four sons and is married already at the age of 26. He is a very responsible and hardworking man who is dedicated to his family and children, as is his wife who stays at home to take care of them. 

In order to earn a living, he has been operating his own car wash for a year now. Although he started very small and with a low number of clients, he has already grown and developed a larger customer base and some success. He is in need of a loan in order to purchase a new machine for washing the cars. This will allow him to continue to grow and satisfy his customers, eventually allowing him to expand and be able to hire another employee in the future. 

He considers this business very profitable and has been enjoying the success of it so far, being able to support his family and provide them with everything that they need. He promises to repay on time and is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for washing cars

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim is a married tailor who has been in business for more than 40 years now. He is very famous in his area and has a lot of customers that he has gained over the years and through his hard work and customer service. 

He has always worked as a tailor his whole life and has always enjoyed it. He enjoyed the fact that he has always been able to be the main source of income for his family and provide for them every year. Now he is in need of a loan for the first time in his career in order to purchase a new sewing machine. 

This will help him to continue his business and even produce better quality work at a faster rate. He is still hoping to continue his business in the future and continue to grow and expand. He really appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ylber

texts.en:
Ylber, who is 31 years old, is married and a father of two very young children between the ages of 2 months and 4 years old. Currently, he is employed doing technical maintenance for a private company while his wife stays home taking care of the house and children. 

Since his salary is very low and not enough to completely provide for his family, he further supplements his income and saves on dietary needs by keeping a cow and planting wheat on the land that he has. 

Now he is requesting a loan in order to purchase guano (fertilizer). He knows that this loan will help his family very much and ensure that they have healthy food to eat. He hopes to offer a better life to his family and a better future.

loans.use: To purchase guano (fertilizer)

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en:
Ilir is a 38-year-old married father of six children, five of whom attend school. He is the family's sole income provider, as his wife stays home to care for the house and children. For more than 12 years now Ilir has planted and cultivated flowers in his two green houses. He has been able to support his family with this business. 

In the spring, Ilir sells dozens of flowers and supplies large flower shops in the area. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase some materials for the expansion of his second greenhouse. He currently has many customers and is well known for his flowers and business. He is optimistic that his success will continue to grow.

Ilir appreciates all of the help provided to him.

loans.use: To purchase some materials for his second greenhouse

loans.name: Shefkije

texts.en:
The borrower, Shefkije, is a regular client of KosInvest. She is 48 years old and married.  She has five children between the ages of 8 and 17 years. Her family does various things in order to earn a living. Her husband is working in construction.  One of her sons sells bottles that he collects from the garbage to different companies, and sometimes Shefkije helps her son with his work. 

She is now requesting a small loan to buy a tractor that will help them to carry the bottles when they are collected instead of having to do it all by hand. She believes that the loan will generate more income and facilitate their work since they can carry more and move faster during the day. She hopes to have a better future for her family and continues to look for ways to improve it.

loans.use: To buy a tractor that will help to carry the bottles when they are collected.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is 30 years old, married, and living in Kosovo with the rest of her entire family, including her own three sons who are between the ages of 3 and 13 years old. For the last 10 years, she has worked as a hairdresser while her husband is a musician who performs for weddings and other celebrations. Because she has worked for so long, her equipment and tools are very old and outdated so she is requesting a loan to purchase new ones and pay for the new inventory. She believes that this loan will help her to develop her business and increase the number of clients that she has. 

Fatime plans on using the income she generates from her business to support her family, especially as her husband’s work is seasonal and he is often without any employment during the winter and colder months. She hopes in the future to be able to further develop her business and open another salon where she can hire employees and generate a larger income and broader client base. She is very happy for this opportunity and looks forward to a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for hairdresing salon

loans.name: Sadeta

texts.en:
Sadeta is 27 years old, married and a mother of 3 children between the ages of 2 and 6 years old. Sadeta is very dedicated to her family and stays at home to care for the children and the house. She does receive a small amount of social help, which contributes to her family’s income. However, her husband, who works in an electric company, receives a very low salary and they are still very poor and living in bad conditions. The house that they live in is very small and one of the rooms is in such poor condition, it is not livable. 

Sadeta is requesting a loan so that she can purchase the materials for them to repair and remake that room so they will enjoy more space and improve their home. She is very pleased to have an opportunity to give her family better living conditions and a positive and comfortable environment in which her children can grow. She is hoping that, in the future, she will be able to find employment and increase the income for her family even more. Her goal is to ensure that her children have a better education and future.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to renovate a room so they will enjoy more space and improve their home.

loans.name: Hafize

texts.en:
Hafize is a 44-year-old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 13 years old, all of them currently attend school. Her 8-year-old son is very ill and until now he could not walk as he has a disease that delayed his ability to walk. Because of the care that her son needed, Hafize was not able to work and dedicated all of her time and energy to his needs. Her husband works as a driver with a low salary and they are very poor. They can barely take care of their daily needs because of the treatment and medical expenses for their son. 

Now that he has started to walk, she is requesting a loan in order to pay for his rehabilitation at a hospital. They are very happy to have an opportunity to finally see their child be better and able to walk completely. They promise to pay on time and appreciate this help very much.

loans.use: to pay for rehabilitation at a hospital for her 8-year-old son.

loans.name: Jasemine

texts.en:
Jasemine is married, 44 years old, and she has three sons. Together, they live in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. While her husband goes to work doing construction, she has owned a cake-making business for more than five years now. 

In the beginning, Jasemine worked from her home, but now she is able to rent out a space for a shop where she sells from. Because of this expansion, she needs a loan in order to purchase an oven for cakes and an ice cream machine. The loan will directly improve and impact her business since it is necessary, now that she is in a shop and will be able to gain more customers. 

Jasemine is very happy with the type of business that she does and she has many customers now that order their cakes for weddings and other celebrations. She hopes to be able to see the same success now in her shop. She thanks the lenders for this opportunity and she promises to pay on-time.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for cakes and an ice cream machine.

loans.name: Shkelqim

texts.en:
Shkelqim is 28-years-old, married and a father of a 2-year-old little girl. They all live in the southern part of Kosovo. Based on tradition he works in agriculture, using a green house to plant and harvest various vegetables for his family to consume and to sell. 

Shkelqim now has two green houses but is planning on adding a third one. He is requesting a loan in order to build a third green house and expand his business, generating more income. He loves his job and that he is able to provide nutrition and financial security for his family through his work.

loans.use: To build a third green house and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Adilja

texts.en:
Adilja is 50 years old and married. Her husband works in a restaurant kitchen and she has operated a handicraft business from her home for the last 10 years now. She really enjoys her work and has gained a lot of fame and customers through working hard and being very dedicated to them. 

For the first now Adilja is requesting a loan in order to purchase more materials for her work. This will allow her to continue to contribute to her family’s income and improve the living conditions of their family, eventually being able to even save some money for their future. She appreciates all of the help.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her handicraft work

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is in her thirties and has four children between the ages of 11 and 22. She is a housewife. Although her husband works as a cleaner, they are still very poor and have lived for years in the same small house in a very small village. Suzana's house urgently needs repair. Her children are often ill due to the conditions of their house especially in the cold and wet winter months when poor insulation allows mold and other bacteria to enter the home. Since they have always been poor, Suzana and her family have been unable to change their living conditions or save money to make repairs to help their health.

Suzana is requesting a loan to replace the doors and windows and façade on the inside and outside of her house. She is grateful for an opportunity to finally address her family’s health, well-being, and living conditions. Suzana promises to pay her loan back on time.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new doors and windows.

loans.name: Safet

texts.en:
Safet is 43 years old and has five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old.  They live in the southern part of Kosovo and his wife stays at home taking care of the children and the house. For more than 10 years now, he has been running his own business making kitchen cabinets and other furniture for individual customers and for businesses.
 
He is very well known in his area. He has a lot of clients and works very hard and long hours, about 12 hours per day.  He is now requesting a loan to purchase various materials for his work. He believes that the loan will help him to improve his business even more and is hopeful that he will be able to always continue in this line of work as he really enjoys it and is able to secure the needs of his family with it. 

He really appreciates the help from the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase various materials for his work

loans.name: Zylfije

texts.en:
Zylfije is 36 years old and has a son and daughter, ages 3 and 5 years old. Zylfije is a seamstress working from her home while caring for the children and house. At one time, her husband worked in construction locally, but now he works in Kazakhstan in order to make a better living. 

Zylfije makes different types of clothing for her various customers and really enjoys her business. She considers it very profitable and convenient for her to work from home. At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She would love to see her business continue to grow and expand and eventually even to be able to hire an employee to help her. 

Zylfije knows that without this help she would not be able to purchase a new machine and successfully meet the needs of her customers and her goals. She would like to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a 24-year-old single female pharmacy student. Right now, she lives with her mother, sister, and brother and her father lives and works in Germany in order to support them. In order to help her family, Adelina works as a seamstress from home. She has regular clients and really enjoys doing this work. Adelina is very talented and hardworking and she hopes to be able to continue in the future, even while she is enrolled in school. 

Adelina is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine and materials for her work. In the future, she really hopes to expand her business even further. Adelina really appreciates any help she gets.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials for her work

loans.name: Bojana

texts.en:
Bojana, at the age of 27 years old, is married and has two daughters ages 4 and 6 years old. Her family lives in one of the minority villages in Kosovo where her husband works as a cleaner in a school and she helps doing some agricultural work while she is staying home and caring for the house and children.  

Like most families in her community, they live in very poor conditions and have very little money. Usually she plants different vegetables, including tomatoes and potatoes, on her land so that she can provide nourishment to her family and earn some money selling them to others in her neighborhood.  

Currently she needs a loan to purchase some new tools for her machine that makes her work easier and more efficient. She knows that having the machine to help her will improve her quality of life by making things easier for her and allowing her to generate more income. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase some new tools for her machine that makes her work easier and more efficient

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en:
Zorica is 51 years old and married with one son. Her husband works in an electrical company with such a low salary that they live in a house that a humanitarian organization built for them. They are very grateful and happy to have a new place to live as their previous home was very old and small. 

Zorica is very ill and does not have enough money to pay for her doctor bills from her husband’s salary. She is looking for a loan in the amount of 700 euros so she can pay for wood, coal and medical treatment. With the wood and coal she will be able to keep warm and her health will be a little better during the last part of the winter. She will also be able to pay for some doctors. This way they can continue to use her husband’s salary to pay for their daily expenses. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for wood, coal and medical treatment

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en: Zineta wants to thank the lenders for all of her previous loans that she had been given. With those loans she was able to renovate her toilet and improve the health conditions of her family and to purchase materials for making her handicrafts. Now, for the third time, she is requesting another loan for her same business to buy materials for making handicrafts which she has been very satisfied with. Thanks to the last loan she was able to gain more customers and generate more income. This time she is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 euros to purchase additional materials and further expand her business. She is very grateful for all of the opportunities that have been awarded to her and the progress her life has made due to the help.

loans.use: to buy material for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Besim

texts.en:
Besim is 28 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. He lives with his family. His mother is a pensioner. Besim is very hardworking and loves his family very much. To earn a living, he works in construction. Besim is the main income provider of his family as his wife stays at home to care for their son and household. 

Besim is engaged in agricultural work in his community, which supplements his income and provides for his family’s nutritional needs. At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase a cow. The cow will be consumed by his family and any excess meat will be sold locally. Purchasing a cow will allow Besim to save money on food costs. Eventually, Besim would like to purchase cows in order to sell milk and diary products. 

He thanks all of the lenders for their help, which he appreciates very much.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.en:
A $ 600.00 loan is offered to Laurinda to improve her business. She is married and has two children. 

Laurinda opened her kiosk in 2007.  She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for (Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, fish and bread. She is generating a good income from selling. Laurinda has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Laurinda is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for (Fanta, Cocacola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, fish and bread

loans.name: Ylfete

texts.en:
Ylfete is a married mother of 3 children, one son and 2 daughters between the ages of 4 and 12 years old. Her husband works on their land where they plant grapes that they sell to different companies and in the market in order to make a living. 

According to Ylfete the business is profitable and they are able to support and provide for all of their family needs with the income. Even though they make enough money to sustain their lives, it is not enough to be able to invest money into anything else. 

Their house is old and is in need of immediate renovations, specifically to replace the doors and windows to provide better insulation and health conditions in the home. She is very happy to have the opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family and has being waiting a very long time to be able to complete this work. She hopes to offer her children a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To renovate the doors and windows to provide better insulation

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She is married and she is  living in a town with her family.
Ana opened her business in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy hack saws, knifes,needles and others things. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is happy with this loan that is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy hack saws, knifes,needles and others things.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as water, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, bread and fish canes. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Matilda is living in a town nearby a school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy water, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, bread and fish canes.

loans.name: Hajrije

texts.en:
Hajrije is 31 and single, living with her mother and her married brother, as her father passed away a long time ago. Her brother provides income for the family by working in construction, and in order to earn a living, Hajrije works as a seamstress. Originally, she began her work learning from a professional seamstress that she would work alongside of and with, but has now managed to become good enough to work on her own. 

She has been able to establish many clients with her work, and she loves her job very much. Since she works from home, she is also able to make a better income, since she does not have to pay for the space of a shop. It is clear how hardworking she is, as she continues to work for another private seamstress for extra income for her family. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine to help improve her business. She hopes in the future to be able to open her own shop and work only for herself.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to help improve her business.

loans.name: Verica

texts.en:
Verica is 55 years old and married without any children. Her husband receives a pension from  the railway company and she receives social help. They are very poor and live in terrible conditions. Their house is old and does not provide a very healthy environment. 

Verica is requesting a loan to be able to façade the house and provide better insulation.  She wants to  make their home comfortable and healthier for them to live in. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she is very thankful to the lenders for the opportunity to get her home in order so she can enjoy a better and more comfortable life. 

Verica plans on getting a job soon so that she can contribute to a stable and more secure income.

loans.use: to renovate her house with  better insulation to  make her home comfortable and  healthier to live in.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 33 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 USD to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $70.  

Martina earns a good income from her business. She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk and water. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past twelve years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk and water

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Virginia to improve her business. Virginia opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store like noodles, body lotion, water, sugar, salt, milk, oils, fish, cigarettes and cards. She generates a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Virginia is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, body lotion, water, sugar, salt, milk, oils, fish, cigarettes and cards

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. Many people come every day to buy things at her kiosk. She will buy some additional supplies such as: hard drink beer, soft drinks, milk, fanta, noodles, cigarettes, oils, water, and bread. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hard drink beer, soft drinks, milk, fanta, noodles, cigarettes, oils, water, and bread

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 29 years old and she is married. She is now applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She opened her food stall in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as chairs, tables, glasses, plates, spoons, rice and vegetables. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, glasses, plates, spoons, rice and vegetables for her food stall

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 34 years old and married.  

She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fish canes, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and slippers. 

She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Paulina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy fish canes, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and slippers

loans.name: Julmira

texts.en: Julmira is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has four children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, oils, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes and water. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, oils, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes and water

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is applying for a loan of $700 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy supplies for her store including stock of fish, cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko drinks, Sprite, and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
She is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people (including students) come to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy fish, cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko drink, Sprite, and biscuits.

loans.name: Beatris

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Beatris to improve her business. She is 18 years old. She is single, and she has a food stall where many people come to eat every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as dishes, pans, spoons, buckets, vegetables and rice. She has been involved in business activities since 2012. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Beatris independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy dishes, pans, spoons, buckets, vegetables and rice

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Elisa to improve her business. She is married, has five children and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. 

She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, Sagiko (a soft drink), water, milk, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, slippers, biscuits and noodles. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Elisa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, Sagiko, water, milk, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, biscuits, noodles and slippers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She is married, and she opened her second hand store in 2009. She will use the loan to buy shirts (long sleeve and short sleeve), trousers, and shorts. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Francisca is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts (long sleeve and short sleeve), trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Elia

texts.en: Elia is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is married and has one child. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, beer, oils and water. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 400 USD. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, beer, oils and water.

loans.name: Joanita

texts.en:
Joanita, 35 years old, is applying for a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She runs a kiosk in front of her house. Joanita will use the loan to buy stock, such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, noodles, water, body lotion and slippers, to keep in her store. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Joanita lives in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, noodles, water, body lotion and slippers

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta is 27 years old and married. She is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.

Berta will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her kiosk, including noodles, oil, sugar, and coffee and other stock items. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, oil, sugar, and coffee and other stock to keep in her kiosk

loans.name: Macolada

texts.en:
A $1500 loan is offered to Macolada to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. 

She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like refrigerated hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), body loosen, milk, coffee, sugar, and salt. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Macolada is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), body loosen, milk, coffee, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as papayas and vegetables.
 
Lucia opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy papayas and vegetables.

Lucia opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. And she is happy with this loan because it offers the chance to improve her living conditions in the future.

Paulina will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as wood, glass, and glue. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.name: Fernanda

A $600 loan is being offered to Fernanda to improve her business. She is married and opened her tailoring business in 2009 with her own working capital . She will use the loan to buy thread, sewing needles, shirts and pants. She is generating a good income from her business.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing a business. Fernanda is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy thread, sewing needles, shirts and pants

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Madalena to improve her business.  She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, sugar, salt, eggs, bread and oils.  She generates a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in a business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, salt, eggs, bread and oils

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif is 44 years old, married, and has three children. All of his children are going to school. His family is an IDP - Internally Displaced Person from Khojaly city and now is living at Abseron region. Arif has a small store and in this store he sells different shoes to customers. Arif has been in this business for three years. Today he needs a loan and has applied for an amount of 2,000 AZN to buy shoes for the new spring season. It's his second loan; previously he took a loan from the Kiva organization and successfully paid it off. Arif says he is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new spring season.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas, ya que eso son las integrantes, mujeres unidas que se ayudan para poder salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde Bernardita, en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos.
Bernardita a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo en su despensa, está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tomate, cebolla, locote, zanahoria, papa, harina, panificados, lácteos, bebidas heladas, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The group is called "Mujeres Unidas," as that's what the members are: women united who help one another so that they can succeed. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which Bernardita, in her last survey, was shown at a poverty level within level one, that is to say with low income. Bernardita, through her work and effort at her general store, is striving to improve the living conditions of her and her family through their joint work. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of tomatoes, onions, peppers, carrots, potatoes, flour, baked goods, dairy products, frozen drinks, with which she will be able to continue selling and that way continue striving to improve her poverty situation.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, peppers, carrots, potatoes, flour, baked goods, dairy products, cold drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Pedrozeñas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Pedrozeñas es un grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas se están ayudando para poder salir adelante, todas ellas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Cynthia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que por medio de su trabajo y con la ayuda de sus seres queridos ha podido ayudarlos. Cynthia vende ropas y joyas, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Cynthia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas de verano, y también de joyas, y asi seguir con su venta. Todas están agradecidas, ya que por medio de las capacitaciones y las charlas están ayudando a las integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Pedrozeñas" is a group in the city of Caacupé, where all are helping one another to succeed. All of them are doing their very best to improve  their living conditions and those of their families.

Cynthia is one of the members of this group. She is a very self-sacrificing woman, who by means of her work and with the support of her loved ones has been able to help her family. 

Cynthia sells clothing and jewelry, and says that she has acquired a good clientele as she always has very good products to offer her customers.
